Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, newly renovated, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ELH1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and are very happy to recommend to others. Considering the hotel's 2 star rating (we have been told by a friend who works in hotels that in USA this refers to the facilities on offer, not necessarily the standard of decor etc) we were not expecting it to be anything special. In fact, we were pleasantly surprised. It is in an old building and the narrow reception foyer was being renovated during our stay though this didn't cause any problems. The staff were welcoming and helpful with how to get to places. There is complimentary wifi in the bedrooms and complimentary hot drinks in recption as well as an ice machine and snack machine. Another nice touch is that there is a computer and printer in the lounge reception where your can print flight boarding passes for free! The room we had on the 10th floor had great views over the skyline. The bed was comfortable and the room, nicely decorated, modern and very clean. Only slight thing is the bath towels are rather small- not bath sheet size at all! But if that's my only complaint then it ca't be bad! The location is excellent, next to China town and short walk to Union square- the main shopping area, and also close to many excellent restaurants and cafes. Across the road are a couple of cafes which do excellent breakfasts. For such a central location, it provides excellent value for money and would stay here again if we are lucky enough to go to San Francisco another time!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lana_S720
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 2012. Great location in downtown San Francisco. Walking distance to Union Square cable car turn around, and a block walk to street car stops. We could see the Chinatown gate from our room. The room was smallish, but very clean and comfortable. There were some renovations happening in the lobby, but this did not affect the rooms at all. Value for money was good, but you did need to pay for internet and computer use in the lobby (no wifi). I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, and priced right!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan H
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. It's a bit older, but they are currently doing some renovations. The location is central to literally everything. It's near the BART, various bus stops, the cable cars, etc. The area seemed safe (near Chinatown and Union Square). We stayed here for 4 nights, and I only have a few minor complaints. As many others have written, the shower curtain is incredibly annoying. The bathroom sink is maybe one of the smallest I've ever seen. The remote and hairdryer are attached to the furniture. Lastly, the elevator is really slow. As you can see, these are minor issues, and nothing that would prevent me from giving this hotel 5 stars. There is a computer in the lobby to print your boarding passes for flights, and free wifi. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful. The price of this hotel in comparison to others is amazing. You'll be getting a great value for your money. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Markknighton
Reviews.Content: Great inexpensive hotel located on the door step of China Town and the main shopping areas of Market Street and all the high end boutiques. Very friendly staff and a great hotel for both tourist and business and I will indeed book this hotel again. No in-house room service but there are numerous cafes and restaurants located very close.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice if you are not picky”
Reviews.Author: traveldayne
Reviews.Content: What a lovely looking hotel entrance. That was my first thought when i arrived after a long 12 hrs flight from europe to San Francisco which was our first  stop. When we entered at the lobby they are in the middle of little renovation. We were here for 4 nights. Ok to make it clear I am not a high maintanince hotel customer.my criteria are simple : good price , location, friendly service, clean rooms, beds & shower. Of course a free wifi is a big plus! And i can tell you Baldwin hotel have it all except for the window curtains (few inches too short), the irritating ventilator noise in the toilet and the heater getting a bit noisy for some reason in the middle of the night. If you can put up with that then you are OK. The hotel offer no free parking but for US$30 a day .  Based on location and cleaniless alone , you just can't beat the deal! I would stay here again if I were to come back .

Reviews.Title: “The stay was great.”
Reviews.Author: Sharkphilpa
Reviews.Content: Great room for a great price. Very clean with outstanding housekeeping service. Ournext trip to San Fran will include The Baldwin.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Perfect location & Great price”
Reviews.Author: Adpentinc
Reviews.Content: For us, this hotel was at the perfect location. It's 100 feet from China Town's Gate, approximately 5 minutes to Union Square and just a few minutes from all the Muni-bus stops which can take you all over the city. This is also one of main stop for all you folks who would like to do a double Decker city bus tours. With many restaurants, bars/wine bars near by to choose from, you will not be disappointed. We opted to eat all over China Town so perfect location for us. The streets were well lit and you always feel safe walking around. Don't listen to other whiner posters who say differently. IT IS CLEAN AND SAFE all hours of the night. The Hotel was older but it is charming. They were in the process of renovation while we were there so when they get done, I'm sure its going to be beautiful. The room was small but adequate for the two of us. If you have more than two I would ask for a larger room. Housekeeping did a terrific job of keeping our room clean and follow our small request with no issues. The hotel offers free coffee 24/7 but did not offer any complimentary breakfast. No bagel, no muffins , nothing at all for breakfast :-( That was the only negative that I can see. We requested a room with street view and received the room #802 on 8th floor. The room has a nice view of China Town's gate as well as other city building; however, down side to that is that you can hear the trucks and garbage pick up late in the night (2-3 am). It's loud enough to wake you up in dead sleep and can keep you up. If you want a peaceful night of sleep than ask to be away from the outside window. I have to thank the staffs of this hotel. They were SUPER friendly, polite and just plain courteous. It was really a pleasure to see. They all went out their way to help us plan our travel around town by drawing up maps and bus stops each day and every time we asked with a smile or laugh. We honestly enjoyed their attitudes and well manor behavior . THANKS FOR ALL YOUR HELP ESPECIALLY THE YOUNG LADY AT THE FRONT DESK. I WOULD NOT HESITATE TO RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL FOR MY OWN FAMILY AND WILL DEFINITELY WILL VISIT THEM AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: BritTravellingAround
Reviews.Content: Great location close to China Town. The wifi was pretty good and the bed was comfortable. The reception area was a bit tatty as there was some renovation work going on, but it didn't disturb us too much. Room was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “good location,good value”
Reviews.Author: MJTBatemansBay
Reviews.Content: great location, staff very accomodating. Room small but clean and functional. Close to Chinatown and downhill walk to BART and shopping. Many restaurants in China Town to choose from. Be wary of the camera shops in Chinatown especially 410 Grant St. Dishonest con artists.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: H H
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a safe neighborhood and close to shop and restaurant. I stayed on the 8th floor: nice high ceiling, big closet, fluffy towels, complete set of toiletry, modern style bedding and a save. Low hot water pressure in the morning for shower, housekeeping is average. Overall is not bad of a hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: peter e
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Baldwin and were pretty pleased at the standard of the hotel. It is a great location they are in the final process of renovations but the rooms have been completed. They are compact but are very good. Do not get a room faconf Grant street as they are noisy and you will find it difficult to sleep. Also do not get a room next to the lift, it makes a noise. We were able to get moved from the first room, the service excellent. Make sure they turn off the central heating that automatically comes to the room even though it is hot outside.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: daytrippa07
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel at a good price. Located at the entrance to Chinatown, it has friendly staff, free Wifi and comfortable beds. Room was on the small side. Free tea/coffee in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel - great location and value”
Reviews.Author: suecs Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, felt safe walking in the area at night after going out evenings. Near shopping, restaurants, art galleries, China Town, public transportation. The room was very clean. Good accommodations. NIce staff. A little noisy in the morning on our side of the building due to ally with trash pick up for hotel and restaurant below our window which we preferred to keep open. Closing the window helped. Not a big issue. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: va70aux
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to SF. I got lucky and stayed here at the Baldwin Hotel for one night. The room was nice, clean, and cozy. It was at a great location too, walking distance to public transportation, shops, and eateries. When I come back, I'll be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Affordable Accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: dreamtraveler_12
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Baldwin Hotel. We were as happy this year as we were last year. It was centrally located so we could walk just about anywhere or catch a trolley or bus. It was clean, comfortable and quaint. The room including the bathroom was very clean. The linens and towels(even the cute animals) were very nice and smelled good too. Hotel staff was pleasant and very helpful. This hotel is awesome if you don't need the luxurious amenities and want to spend your money on good restaurants and attractions( and there are plenty of them in SF). Definitely will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: triskank
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights in March/April. The location was excellent. Good value for the money. Room was clean and comfortable. Before my visit I emailed the hotel with a question and had a very quick response from them. My room was at the front of the hotel so there was a bit of street noise but never enough to keep me awake. I loved being steps away from Chinatown, a couple of blocks from Union Square and all its amenities (restaurants, shopping, public transportation.)

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: fanyoni
Reviews.Content: the room very small but the location was great great great. we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: bjenko
Reviews.Content: This was a great surprise! I was expecting much less for SF. It was cheap, clean, comfy and a real pleasure to stay in. Very close to Chinatown and union square. Tour buses stop out the front. The only bad thing I can say about the hotel is that the heater in the room hummed and hurdled all night which did become quite annoying. If I was in sf again I'd prob stay on the wharf if I was doin the tourist thing, but if I wanted to shop I'd stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Central located,comfortable rooms, Cost effeciant”
Reviews.Author: jaime3
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending 6 days in San Francisco with my girlfriend. We were in town for a conference I was presenting at, and we decided that we'd stay for the week and enjoy the town. After searching tripadvisor for the best possible hotel that would be close to the conference center, close to transportation, not a dump, and wouldn't break my budget. Man, did the Baldwin DELIVER!! We arrived and checked into our room 802 no problem. Our room was clean, great updated bathroom, flat panel tv, and a very comfortable queen sized bed. Our room faced the main street outside. There's no central air/AC, but the weather was cool and within seconds of opening the windows, plus the ceiling fan, our room was always cool. Everyday except for 1, we were out on the town all day, and returned in the evening. This is a great place to stay if you're going to be wondering around San Fran! The money we saved on hotel, we were able to budget and see everything! Wine Country, Alcatraz, The Mission, Fishermans Warf, China town! Being located right in Union Square, you are steps away from all the shopping, and public transportation. We took the Bart to and from the Airport, we took the buses to the mission, and we took the trollies to the warf. You can't beat that! We didn't have any problems with noise, though I could see how people would be bothered by trucks at night. One of the nights when they picked up the trash you could hear it pretty well, but we just closed the window a little and that was that. It's not a Four Seasons, or Hilton, so don't expect all the glitz and glammour. Do expect to recieve all the essentials, a comfortable room, great location, great staff, and a great way to sleep on a budget. Next time I go to San Fran I will 100% staying back.I have nothing negative to say.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mountains94
Reviews.Content: I did research and was not disappointed by this hotel. Very basic and clean. When I walked in, the lobby was under construction and I was apprehensive about whether the reviews were accurate. To our pleasure, they were. If you are looking for a very clean hotel, with free internet, and centrally located, this is the hotel for you. No frills. The staff is extremely pleasant, helpful, and responsive to any requests. We stayed in 805 and had the windows open each night because the room became very hot. Only one night was the noise extremely loud and we were there for four nights.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great stay at The Baldwin”
Reviews.Author: cmglin
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at The Baldwin. Nice clean room and bathroom. Friendly staff who can help you with any questions. You have everything you need with plenty of restaurants, shopping and Chinatown at your door step.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful City, Beautiful Hotel (Could not be Happier)”
Reviews.Author: TheConstantTravelor
Reviews.Content: Like everybody seems to say, the location is perfect. The hotel staff are truly helpful and know the area well. The room I was in was very comfortable, clean, quiet, and had a charmingly antique-like ambiance. I was a little nervous when I found out the room had no air-conditioning; however, there was absolutely no need for it, although it was September (typically the warmest month of the year). Granted, this hotel is not as fancy as the Four Seasons; but I don't think any one could find a better value for the money while staying at the Baldwin. When I visit San Francisco again I will definitely stay at the Baldwin Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and great bath!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug2203
Reviews.Content: Hotel Baldwin sits at the gates of Chinatown with a Starbucks next door! What more can you ask for? Hotels in SF are very expensive and this hotel was perfect for a young couple in their 20s on a budget. The rooms were clean, and quite boutiquey but nice with vintage baths. The location is why you're staying here and it is so close to all of the sights! Free tea and coffee 24/7 was also a nice touch would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: Bootleggers
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a well priced, good, clean hotel conveniently located near Union Square, China Town, etc. then the Baldwin is an excellent choice. The rooms are comfortable, good size closet with small safe, good beds - bonus: the windows open! Free coffee/tea, ice, around the clock. We stayed 10 days and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for SF”
Reviews.Author: Lisa T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baldwin for 5 nights as a family for a business trip I had. The hotel was close to downtown - and at the entrance gate of Chinatown. It was clean, and close to everything. The room was on the smaller size, and the hotel had a vintage feel (you received a key set), but it was definitely a bargain for its location in SF.

Reviews.Title: “nice!!”
Reviews.Author: mariel g
Reviews.Content: my husband and i enjoy very much our stay. very easy to go everyway. nice service. walking distance from train station, union square and steps from china town. very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Andy C
Reviews.Content: Really good location and great value. The lobby is a bit dingy, but my room was smart and a decent size. Staff very helpful, overall top value just off Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for SF”
Reviews.Author: sswagner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baldwin for three nights and enjoyed the hotel and its location. The walk from Powell Street station (BART from the airport) was not too long. It was only a few blocks on Grant from Market Street. The hotel itself is just off of Union Square and is within easy walking distance to Chinatown. There are many shops and restaurants in the vicinity. The value of the hotel was good as SF can be quite expensive. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the area. We had some good advice for restaurants as well as a place to print and send a fax. The room had Wifi available at no extra charge. We stayed on the 8th floor, I noticed some other reviews mentioned the one room next to the elevator shaft. On the 8th floor, that was room 801, So I guess if you are booked in a "01" room, you might want to reconsider if you are a light sleeper. There was room service available, although we did not use it. Overall, it was a good stay, and we were able to get where we wanted to go easily from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location. EXTREMELY clean room. Price was definitely RIGHT !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ksouzakava
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again for sure. The location was PERFECT for our 2 day stay. Great eating places in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE WITH GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: misharpittman
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my daughter and were very pleased with our experience at the Baldwin!We could not have asked for a better location it is very easy to get around in this very nice part of the city.The hotel is located just down from the gates to Chinatown and has lots of great shopping all around with Union Square.We would walk around till 11 at night and found the entire area very busy and lots of things to see and do.The hotel staff is very helpful and we had a wonderful time.I would not hesitate to book with this hotel even though it is older it is very clean and a very comfortable base to explore the city from.Our room was on the ninth floor and we could hear the city noises below like a sax player who played in the evening it sounded wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: littlefoot303
Reviews.Content: I love the location. Close to Chinatown, Starbucks, and Bart. Union Square and the cable cars were just a short walk away. Our room was very clean. I was surprised at how quiet it was. We closed the windows at night and could hardly hear any outside noise. We were on the 7th floor. The staff was very friendly and I loved the towel animals! The only drawback - The clingy shower curtain. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Karina D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baldwin Hotel for 2 nights in mid February 2012. We booked the "shopping package" which included free parking for the 2 days. Upon arrival the staff was very friendly and helpful and assisted us with maps and tips for the area. Free coffee was also provided in the lobby. The room & bathroom were very clean and comfortable. The little heater was a bit noisy in the evening but warmed up the room perfectly. The room service was great and clean towels were given to us every day. The hotel is very close to the Union Square, Cable Cars, bus stops, 7-Eleven, China Town, etc. Grant Ave is reasonably quiet and there was hardly any noise during the night. To sum up - great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...but it has its quirks”
Reviews.Author: SaintPaulite
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Union Square neighborhood and near the gates of Chinatown (which is fantastic to visit!!). Took the BART to Montgomery and walked to the hotel. Great pedestrian location. I stayed early February 2012 in Room 706 for 4 nights. The hotel was going through some renovation in the lobby but did not affect my stay. The staff were helpful. The neighborhood felt very safe! Quirkie things: Clawfoot bathtub with clingy shower curtain (annoying), but room was very clean. Outside at night (midnightish??) there was a significant crashing sound like someone was sorting all the neighborhood glass for recycling (needed earplugs for that) and this happened more than one night. I had many issues with the internet service, but was able to hop a ride on another local network. Long story short, for the money I did OK, but next time I will consider another hotel-maybe I will find one a bit better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: hms203
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I traveled to SF for a short vacation and stayed at the Baldwin. We were very happy with the entire stay. The hotel is small and very old, but has a lot of character and is newly renovated. We stayed in Room 904 on the 9th floor on the advice of other reviewers. We requested a room that was not in the front of the hotel or near the elevator. We didn't have a view, since we were on the side of the building, but we didn't mind it. It was quiet. The room was spotlessly clean and everything in our room was new. It had a flat screen tv and we had a regular tub in our bathroom, not a claw foot tub. The room was a little small with the 2 beds, but the closet was spacious and so was the bathroom. We had plenty of room for the 2 of us. There was a safe in the closet, hair dryer, iron/ironing board - all the usual amentities, except coffee. You need to go to the lobby for coffee or tea, but that was ok for us. The ice and vending machines are also in the lobby. The radiator is loud and makes strange squealing noises. We called it the pig :-) The pig woke up the first night when the heat was turned on and we called downstairs to have them turn it off. A man came up immediately and shut off the valve. It squealed some more during the first night, but we didn't hear anything for the next 2 nights since it was shut off. Yes, the pipes also squeal when you shower, but that didn't bother us. We normally travel with ear plugs due to snoring, so we really weren't bothered by noises and slept really well. The staff at the Baldwin was impressive! Very nice, very friendly and so helpful in telling us about the city, how to get to certain places by public transportation and good restaurants to eat in. The towel animals on the bed each day was a plus! The location of the hotel was incredible! You walk out the front door and to the left are the gates to Chinatown. There were so many restaurants and shops. We took 2 trips into Chinatown. To the right are high-end clothing stores like Armani, Betsy Johnson, Coach, etc. and the hotel is only a few blocks to the buses and cable cars. We spent the 3 days we were there sightseeing and were gone most the day. The Baldwin is a great value for the location, cleanliness and helpful, friendly staff. I would stay there again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: malibu-jenni
Reviews.Content: very comfortable room, mins walk from station, and square. Right by the gates of china town. We also had a 2 day pass for the hop on/off bus, and was pleasantly surprised that one of its; stops was right across the road of our hotel - very handy! no breakfast at the hotel but walking distance to a number of cafes and diners. desk staff friendly and helpful. internet access and printing available which we needed for the excursions and transfers we had previously booked. oh and for my fellow scots - there is a shop round the corner that sells irn bru!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Carlid
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my choice to stay at the Baldwin. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect with easy access to public transport and lots of restaurants in the area. Being close to Union Square and China Town it is perfect for shopping. It is also within easy walking distance to some of the great sights in the city. And the price made it even more atractive. The rooms are not the biggest or very modern but it is comfortable and clean. The bed is comfy and there is a safe in the room for valuables. I will definately stay here again if I visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: luckyrabbit25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with hubby. Hotel location was good! Easy to locate. Starbucks n 7-11 just around the corner! Walking distance to union square where u can find fast food restaurants, cafes, Macy's department store, victoria 's secret, h &m and forever 21!!! n it is just few steps away from china town! It is a good base to explore San Francisco. Hotel room was good, clean n adequate, not small imo. Wifi is not free n lift was old n slow. overall very good experience. I will definitely stay here again given the competitive price and location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location tiny beds though!”
Reviews.Author: whitney mae m
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right outside the gates to china town and a short walk to cable cars (5 mins) also right but a BART station although we never used this. Its easy enough to walk to union square and market from here too. The hotel is nice and clean staff seemed nice too. Beds were quite small though and the radiators started making funny noises about 3 in the morning in both mine and our friends room even though they werent on, also we found rooms to be very warm but then we dont like to be hot at night. The rooms were nice and clean and when they were made up you got a towel animal on your bed which is a nice touch. this hotel is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: carpetburn
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive, clean, good location, nicely decorated. Rooms were small by US standards but Europeans wouldn't call them small. Very good value for money. You'd have to have very high standards or be very rich to feel uncomfortable or unhappy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler43
Reviews.Content: Great location, great value, clean, nice amount of space, staff always nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value location and shopping”
Reviews.Author: J O
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very easy walk from BART and bus system that will take you just about anywhere. It is also possible to walk 'FLAT' no hills to Fishermans wharf it takes about 20 minutes, but is a safe and scenic walk. Some of the best shopping I have have ever experiences on the same street and surrounding streets. The hotel is a small boutique hotel and doesn't have a breakfast or anything super special, except a lot of charm, extremely clean and great freindly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, solid hotel, in central location!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel G
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin Hotel offered a great value for a clean, quiet, and ample sized room near the Union Square and Chinatown areas in downtown San Francisco. There weren't many frills, but the service was very friendly, there was free coffee in the lobby, and you can't beat the location for $73/night in late December! We had stayed across the street at the Hotel Triton for the first half of our stay, and while it offered many fancy amenities (wine hour, hot toddies, etc.), the Baldwin was much cheaper and pleasant as well. I would highly recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Really clean, great location, traditional features”
Reviews.Author: Boysalsa
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel for exploring San Francisco, the Baldwin is excellently located for exploring China Town, Nob hill and Union Square. The rooms are a little dated but spotlessly clean and different towel arrangements on the bed each day which are great fun. TV channel selection was excellent and we would dedinately return and use again if exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for not a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: brijcook
Reviews.Content: I recently tried to book a hotel in the financial district of San Francisco. Due to a conference, all the major hotels were booked, but the Baldwin had a room for $129 / night. I was coming for business without a family, so I booked the room. Upon arriving, I was disappointed. The hotel is clearly quite old, and while not falling down, it's upkeep could be better. The rooms have metal keys (the large kind you can't take with you), the room itself was very small, the mirror in the bathroom was not above the sink, ect... plus no air conditioning and a very old TV. It wasn't awful, and was fine for one night on a business trip, but it was by no means enjoyable and I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lori G
Reviews.Content: The baldwin is a renovated (although not very recently) old style hotel in the heart of San Francisco's financial district. It is just a short walk away from everything...the ferry building, BART, SoMa, Market Street, and much more. Great restaurants abound in the area. Chinatown (and more great restaurants) starts just a block away. The front desk is efficient and courteous. One small elevator services the building, but that is not a problem. Rooms are clean and efficient, not fancy. But for the price (unless you are there when a convention is in town), it is a deal! If you want to save your money for the restaurants and sights, then stay at the Baldwin. If you are looking for a "destination" hotel, this is not your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great price/location but smelly linens & bad bed”
Reviews.Author: mjtraveler22
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin Hotel charges an incredibly low rate for SF near Union Square. But the linens and pillows smelled sweaty. The bed was very uncomfortable, squeaky, and caused my back to spasm. The internet speed was inconsistent and very slow (1 Mbyte) -- when it was working. The radiator could not be controlled. The pipes whistled while showering. The room was tiny and the bathroom had no counter space. No luggage rack.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brad S
Reviews.Content: If this is the price range you're looking for this hotel is great. Two of us stayed here in early December. No issues with booking, fees or anything of that nature. Location is fantastic. Plenty of shopping around, right next to Chinatown, we walked down to the ferry building and plenty of nice restaurants in the area. The only taxi we had to catch was to Golden Gate Park. The staff were nice, we had a small problem with the TV remote not working but they attended to it immediately. The room was big enough for the two of us and clean and ready even though we got their a bit before normal check in time. We really anjoyed staying here and would recommend it, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Pheely
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights during Christmas and loved the hotel. Great location with everything needed close by. We will definitely consider it on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: RhondaZP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights based on reviews here. It's clean, affordable and very central location. Chinatown is just across the road, Union Square and department stores only a 10 minute walk away. Also walked to Cable Car Museum and Nob Hill without problems. Access to this hotel is easy. Just a couple of minor negatives: The shower leaks all over the floor despite the curtain and of course the curtain sticks to you when in the shower. Cannot turn down room heater. The room was SO hot we couldn't turn down the heater so staff came up to turn it off completely. We were given a portable heater which we didn't end up using. We were at the back of the hotel but still couldn't sleep with the window open due to noise. Nights were hot and uncomfortable also due to the type of bedding which didn't breath. I would stay again but when the weather was not so cold but also not too hot as only a ceiling fan in room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Bernard68
Reviews.Content: Although we only stay there for a night, it provided us a good experience and memory. Great Location, Great Service, Great Deal. The Towel Orgami - Crab remind us to visit Fisherman's Wharf as our first stop at San Francisco. Love It. Will definitely in our list on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Crusaders
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and loved the Hotel and loved San Francisco. Fantastic location and unable to fault the Hotel. Great central location with everything needed close at hand. Stayed on the 6th floor over looking the street. San Francisco was the highlight of my holiday and the Baldwin just capped it off. I will return to San Francisco and I will being staying here again Stayed on the 6th floor over looking the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel & well priced”
Reviews.Author: Baggers82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here December 26th- 29th 2011. It is a very nice hotel and the staff were friendly and helpful and it was a great price in an excellent location, only about a 15 minute walk to pier 39 and right in the centre of town. Our particular room was not laid out well, you could only exit the double bed from one side, I think this is unique to our room though. If you stay here I would recommend requesting a room though that is not street facing, as the street cleaning in San Francisco is very noisy and woke us up a lot! I will stay here again when I revisit though it was such a great location.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER deal - great location”
Reviews.Author: Amy S
Reviews.Content: You will not find a better deal in SF. It's old but clean enough and charming. Think European style hotel. We loved being so close to Chinatown. Really liked the towel origami and the friendly staff. Noisy by the elevator, but not intolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Salitini
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights and were really happy with our stay. When we first checked in, we were in a room next to the elevator, which woke us up every time someone rode in it. The next morning I requested a room change, which the staff quickly organised for us. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Every day, housekeeping would make an origami-esque towel animal, which was a great novelty! The bed was very comfy. Only downside was the bathroom. It was very clean, but had a clawfoot bath (great if you're having a bath, but not great if you're having a shower). It was really difficult to get the shower curtain to stop water from spraying out onto the floor- we ended up with a flooded bathroom every time we showered. It was also difficult to shower without the shower curtain touching you. We would still probably stay in this location again though- it was super clean and in a fantastic location. We walked to almost everything (caught a cab to fisherman's pier because we were running late for a tour, but we could have easily caught public transport nearby). Definitely recommend this hotel for the location- right on Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Best rate, close to Union Square!!”
Reviews.Author: Kidlearner
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very friendly and professional. Our room was clean and sufficient. Very basic, but had everything we needed. Quiet. A short block from Union Square. We even booked them again for New Year's Eve. No extra perks. There is coffee and tea in the lobby which is nice in the morning. The front door is locked after nine which I appreciate (guests are given a key). The only down side is that parking is not on site. It is very close though. You can pull up in front of the hotel to check in and unload bags before you park and walk back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: apmiyazaki
Reviews.Content: Baldwin Hotel is very well located, near to Union Square, Chinatown, Lombard Street and many other locations. The staff is very friendly, helpful and efficient. The hotel was clean, in the lobby you can find maps, tour brochures and free coffee. Excellent value for the money! I would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for me! :)”
Reviews.Author: myscon1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September 2011. I chose it based on the reviews+price+location. Great choice! Nice staff, decent rooms, great bathroom. 4 issues you may find: 1) actual key not magnetic (not an issue for me, but just an fyi) 2) no ac, so the hallway windows were open to give some cross-air ventilation. Usually you won't need ac anyway (but the day I happened to be there the temp was in the 80s). The fans work well though. 3) because the doors have a little bit of space under them, the noise from the hallway is not muffled. (not an issue if the other hotel visitors are not loud, but you never know) 4) doors are a little close to the beds. But, please don't misunderstand. This Hotel is awesome!!! Free easy-to-use wifi in rooms, nice bathrooms, EXCELLENT location (!!!!!!!), great staff, great price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, some stuff needs attention...”
Reviews.Author: Marlon34872
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for five nights in November. The location is fantastic - central to shops and public transport and a 20 minute walk to the beginning of Fisherman's Wharf. (If you're into that sort of thing.) The room was quite small but very clean and had a nice bed with fresh linen. However the internet was quite slow and required a sign-in each time you used it. The bathroom door wouldn't lock and we were right next to the lift well which made clanking and grinding noises all night. It's a good place to stay but has enough niggles to warrant me looking around next time I'm in San Francisco. Other rooms would probably be better, but try to stay away from the 201/301/401 etc rooms which look like they're next to the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “A great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: travelalirae
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention in town in may. I'm usually one to stay at a five star hotel, but they were all full, and so I ended up at Baldwin. I wasnt sure of staying here but by night two I knew I had found a real gem! The staff here does anything, they really go the extra mile. What a great team. Location is perfect - so close to everything in San Fran and I loved being by china town and the shopping just two blocks away! I was able to spend some of the hundreds I saved by staying at Baldwin! It would be nice if they added a mini fridge or updated the elevators but hey, those are very minor complaints. Overall, if you are considering Baldwin and aren't sure - stop reading reviews and just book this perfect little hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, very close to Chinatown and well connected for public transport”
Reviews.Author: roxanne121
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to Dragon's Gate, the entrance to Chinatown, very close to cablecar & MUNI stops, and a few minutes walk from Market Street where the nearest BART station is as well as a main shopping area. The hotel was clean and well maintained, staff were friendly and efficient, and we enjoyed the towels made into animal shapes to which other reviewers have referred. Coffee was not always available in the morning but there is a coffee shop over the road, and the bagel shop over the road on Sutter is excellent. We would recommend this as a good value clean and well-cared for hotel in a very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: NorthWoodsWanderer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here earlier this week for three days. Rooms are basic but decently furnished and clean, with firm beds. Unlike another San Fran hotel I stayed at previous to this stay, the rooms are big enough not to feel too cramped (by San Francisco standards). Good flatscreen plus cable in room, and free Wi-Fi that worked fine. Like other boutique hotels of this type and age in San Francisco, there is one smaller-sized and slow elevator, so could be a wait at times if you are going to upper floors. Fortunately we were on the third floor. Our room had a very good sized closet and a safe as well. Bathroom with tub/shower combo was fine. Doors seem a little thin as I could hear stuff in our room pretty clearly from hallway, but I did not notice undue noise from the hallway when in room. (There are only a few rooms on each floor, so limited opportunties for noise creation.) There is coffee and tea available but no breakfast. The hotel is pretty basic but does have some small charm about it. Does not feel overly bare or depressing like some budget hotels. Folks at front desk were consistently helpful. If Chinatown is of special interest to you, this hotel is perfect, just steps from the Chinatown gate and all the varied little shops, etc. Easy walking distance of about 1/2 to 3/4 miles to most conference hotels and Moscone Convention Center. Closest BART station is Montgomery. Overall a very good value, and I would not hesitate to stay here again for the price (just under a $100 a night).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ron s
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel last august for 2 nights. It is a very nice place to stay. The location is excellent, almost next to the gate to China Town and close to the centre. Thee room was clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. It had a street view, but we had no problems with any traffic noise. The only downside was that our room was next to the elevator, wich was a bit noisy. Overall a good experience and if we returned to SF, I would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodations and location”
Reviews.Author: RwC2011_11
Reviews.Content: Location was amazingly close to Chinatown. Was easy walking all the way down to Columbus and the pier if you wanted (Trader Joe's!). Room was comfortable, clean, off the street but unfortunately backed the rooftop air conditioning units of various other places. I tried to imagine it as white noise to sleep, which worked ok. We were tucked away down a hall and at the end of a long trip and then walking everywhere we were still able to hunker down with dimsum and a bottle of wine and drift off to sleep. I really enjoyed the central location to Chinatown and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Just good.”
Reviews.Author: kurzew
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 3 nights in Baldwin Hotel. Hotel is located just few blocks from the downtown near China District. Our rom was quite big. Bathroom was small,but clean. Everyday new towels and soap. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. I think rooms should to be renovated a little bit. If you are looking for a fancy place to stay this is not the place for you, but if you are looking for a pleace to sleep in good price range you just found your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Ciru_TO
Reviews.Content: It’s the kind of hotel that grows on you and after a day, you start to call your room home. I had read enough reviews to know what I was getting for my $ especially given how expensive San Fran is, so my expectations were well adjusted! If you are looking for a crisp, brand new hotel - this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a clean, cozy hotel with great service - bingo! The check-in was smooth, and I was pre-billed as I had the package through PriceLine (about $130 per night).The room we got was on the 9th floor (901) facing the street. It was cozy, clean and the bed was comfortable - not too lumpy, not too hard. The tv channels were adequate, the closet was great for storage and the view out to the street was nice. The room has a safe, which was handy. There was also free wi-fi in the room, so that was helpful in planning our next stops, directions etc. On the downside, as with most hotels in San Fran, its an older hotel, and the elevator really shows its age and takes a long time to arrive. We were also in the room right next to the elevator, so in the night, we kept hearing the elevator churning - thankfully only until about midnight, then it started again around 7am. I initially asked to be moved to another room, and the front desk was very nice and accommodating and agreed to show me a room on the 2nd floor. But there was a "homeiness" about the 9th floor room, so we decided to keep it. The heating system is also old so there were weird noises from that. Now for the real reason we stayed here - the location is EXCELLENT!Looking out the front windows you can see Banana Republic right on the corner. Chinatown Gate is right on your doorstep so access to a lot of food choices. For breakfast, there is Cafe Presse (lovely french café - try the Cafe Latte!) and Starbucks right on Grant St. Being Union Square area, there are lots of shopping options in this area including Macy's, DSW, Gap, Walgreens. For public transit, there are cable car stops to the Fishermans' Wharf on Powell Street and MUNI buses that can take you to the Golden Gate Bridge for only $2 per ride! Its a hotel to come and only spend a few hours to get clean, some rest and get out and enjoy San Fran. Of course, as other reviewers mention - the animal decorations are a cute touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations! Central location!”
Reviews.Author: cindy1227
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff! Clean rooms. Very central location! Excellent value for the money! Would stay at the Baldwin Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Basic & Near Everything!”
Reviews.Author: slipperyice
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Baldwin hotel a week for business travel. Cannot beat the location and price. Near Chinatown, Union Square and cable-cars. Very easy to locate all necessities as there are markets and stores everywhere. Buy your trinkets in Chinatown, much cheaper than the rest of the city. meals are pricy everywhere. Avoid Pier 39 and Fisherman's wharf unless you are into the tourism things. Overall i would rate this a 4.5 out of 5 stars for the location, price and front desk/staff-they were very helpful and pleasant people. Now be warned this is a basic hotel, not frivolous. If you're expecting the Ritz-Carleton (which is up around the corner @ $500 a night) go there and be pampered, if you want a basic safe, clean place with an attentive staff at a very reasonable rate, then the Baldwin is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Baldwin Hotel very neat and clean”
Reviews.Author: carleen e
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and was welcomed by the clerk happily. All the clerks we saw were very kind and helpful. I expected the room, especially the bathroom to be outdated, but both were very nice. It looks like it has been renovated recently. Everything was super-clean throughout the hotel. Our room was small, of course. Had a large closet. Two queen beds with nice linens. We didn't miss an a/c. We just opened the windows and/or turned on the ceiling fan. During our three night stay, there was one time that the elevator wasn't available, only for 10 minutes while they "measured" something. The only thing I didn't like: no coffeemaker in the room and there was some kind of garbage truck that came along on two nights, but it was while we were still awake so no problem. We stayed on the 9th floor. Great location. We would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Sree R
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in the Baldwin Hotel when the official conference hotel sold out of the group rate rooms. I was happy with my choice to stay here instead. The rate was actually cheaper than the sold-out rate at the Hyatt anyway. This hotel is old, but it's clean and the furnishings feel modern. It even had a flat-screen TV (though if I was being picky I'd say that I wish it was mounted on the wall facing the bed and that I wish it had more channels). The front desk staff was courteous and efficient. The rooms are small, but I really was only using it to sleep anyway. The only real negative is that the furnace in my room would occasionally clang while it was running, and that sound actually woke me up one night of my two-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “hair hair hair!”
Reviews.Author: realistic5
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I checked the bed and bathroom in 503 for hair. There were at least 10 long black hairs in the bed, on both sheets, on the pillow cases. Even eyelashes! The towels - one had a ball of blonde hair, another ball of black hair. I asked for new sheets and towels - they took me to room 903 to see if that was better - NO - even more hairs on the sheets. They got me new sheets and I had to make my own bed back in 503 - again more hairs on the new sheets! YUK. There were also random hairs in the bathroom - up on the walls, in the bath. The location was great. Even though we had paid in full for the two rooms we still had to give $100 cash for 'incidentals' - there were no incidentals to buy - no mini bar (bad tea and coffee in foyer), no internet - that was $5 cash for 20 mins which gave me time to visit one website it was SO slow and the man was most unhelpful at check-in - didn't tell us check out time, about the net, about drinks around the corner etc. He was only worried about getting the $100 each. I did think I had lost my keys at the end of the holiday - called them from LA airport and Chester did check the room and emailed me to follow up. He was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: RJPITT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 night trip to SF. Location is brill you can walk to all the sites easy. Close to BART stations. Rooms clean and have all the amenities. Paid only 60$ a night, which in my experience is great value. Recommended !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: tb-londontraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, just 1/2 block away from Chinatown gate, near Union Square. Rooms are on smaller than usual massive American hotels, but plenty big enough for two. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was very clean. Bathroom had a clawfoot bath, again very clean. Free Wifi in the room, computer in the lobby required credit card payment. Coffee, tea, ice and vending machine were downstairs near the lobby. Hotel in general like a typical good European small hotel. Staff were very friendly, with very fast registration despite being really late @1am. Big plus was the free in room safe. Great inner city find, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: JudyCohen
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for one night but was very pleased with the Hotel. The location is in a great part of town with easy access to everything. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The street noise can get a little loud but that is to be expected when staying in the city. Loved my animal shaped towel on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little find”
Reviews.Author: Hildakay
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel in a very good part of San Francisco. Staff fairly friendly and helpful. Room very clean and spacious enough, everything you need. Slightly noisy at night in that we had loud people above us - probably be better if you stayed on the top floor and bin men a bit loud in the early hours of the morning but not too bad. Would definitely recommend it - we stayed for a week and could get everywhere we needed to from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for location and price”
Reviews.Author: amymt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal considering it's location! There are no bells or whistles, just a clean place to sleep that is centrally located in SF. From the front of the hotel, you can see the gate to Chinatown, Union Square is two blocks south, and it is an easy walk to the Financial District and the Ferry Terminal. The front doors lock at 9 p.m., but there was always someone at the front desk which made it feel safe. Some people we were traveling with stayed at another more expensive hotel that turned out to be a block away from the Tenderloin district (very sketchy part of town). The Baldwin was a much better hotel with a better location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Gotopinion
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Baldwin Hotel for a few nights while staying in SF. The rooms, while a little outdated are spotlessly clean. All the staff are very friendly, and the cleaning ladies leave very cute towel shaped animals on the bed! Overall a great place to stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MysteryTraveler16
Reviews.Content: A clean room in a hotel with a terrific location at a reasonable price. We've stayed there a few times, but this stay we had a problem with the noise from the garbage trucks during the night. We were on the third floor facing Grant. Some of the reviewers complained about the dated decor. The Baldwin reminds me of the way Hotel Drisco (Pacific Heights) was years ago. Beautiful location, reasonable prices but frumpy. Today Hotel Drisco has had a major facelift and is #2 on Trip Advisor's list. The location is the same, but the room rates aren't. Remember that when you stay at the Baldwin. It's a deal but a future renovation will change that.

Reviews.Title: “not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: casper1230125
Reviews.Content: read a lot of good reviews about hotel being so clean, etc. Well, maybe I have high standards, but carpet was stained and dirty-looking...throughout hotel. The rest of the room was clean, but it would really help if they replaced the carpet. I was quite disappointed. Some of the staff was very friendly, professional, but others very impersonal. I did sleep well there, however, and price was OK for SF.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Scorpionwitch
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for a concert across the Bay in Oakland. Nice clean room with a claw-foot tub in the bathroom. No frills hotel but, as others have said, you can't beat the location. A hundred feet from the Chinatown gate, 2 blocks from a Bart subway station (took this to a nice little area across the bay in Oakland), Around a $20 cab ride to Golden Gate Park and Fisherman's Wharf. Lots of little places to eat, bars, and mini-marts close by. Free coffee and tea in the lobby or there is a Starbucks just outside the door. A little noise from deliveries and garbage trucks in the back alley but not enough to keep us awake. Staff was very friendly and helpful. A quick phone call to the front desk got us a cab right at the front door and they even printed our airline boarding passes for us. I would be glad to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 1sue
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel room at short notice and found this little gem at an amazing price and in a great location near to Union Square and Chinatown. The room was spacious, clean and perfectly adequate for an over night stay at a muc better price than anywhere else. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A good tourist hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: jocelynbok
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights Positives:  Location – very strategic; behind Union Square; at the beginning of Chinatown; easy access to everything – buses, food, shopping, etc.  Room – had a corner room on a high floor; room was spacious and very clean with a nice ceiling fan and huge windows; bathroom was clean and compact. Bed was comfortable.  Service – nothing to comment on as it’s just a tourist class hotel that provides a comfortable, clean, and convenient stay in my opinion; was happy with the check-in and out. Negative:  Had a room at the back end of the building on a high floor; there was a lot of machinery sound coming into the room in the middle of the night (probably from the street or another building next to the hotel building) that caused me to keep waking up. It was very disturbing. Overall: Recommended for short and no frills stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “First Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gerald T
Reviews.Content: For the price and location, this is an outstanding value. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and professional. I will most definitely be using this facility again on my next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Not too expensive in a good central location”
Reviews.Author: LindaH72
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in room 903. Some sound carried up from the street despite being 9 floors up and the shower was really noisy. Apart from that, the room was clean, the bed comfortable and it's location was really central.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: Traveler50311
Reviews.Content: Great location near Union Square and just a block to China Town gate. A fair value for the price. Clean, but small, room and a comfortable bed. The only downside is the bathroom, there is no counter space (just a small shelf), and the bathtub in our room did not drain. The toilet stopped up, but they promptly took care of that and we had no further problems.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: JayanthiV
Reviews.Content: A quick stroll to Union Square and public transport links as well as a stone's throw to the gates of Chinatown. Loved the quirky arrangement of towels on the bed each day! The rooms are clean although they could probably use an upgrade. But for price and convenience, it's well worth staying here. As a solo traveller, I felt very safe in the area. I'd definitely stay here again and have recommended it to my friends (who were on their honeymoon and were upgraded to the top floor!)

Reviews.Title: “Super value”
Reviews.Author: kilcreggan
Reviews.Content: Well, I thought this was a great place to stay - really central, very close to Union Square, just next to Chinatown gate, perfectly clean, a particularly comfy bed and a towel shaped into an animal each day left on our bed. Granted, it may seem a little dated to some guests - the lift could do with a more sympathetic cosmetic makeover, for example - but we didn't want to spend much time there, just wanted to be handy for the city and all its attractions. And do remember that it is in an old building, which has its own charm. The staff were fine, although they did not go out of their way to explain much about the place, eg they keep coffee available for guests at the rear of the lobby but did not tell us this so we found it by chance. It proved handy if you wanted a coffee at the end of your evening, (or perhaps for brekky if you had bought some buns) but there were times when it was empty, which was slightly irritating. But then we remember it's not a five-star hotel. We were in a front street facing room which was noisy with bin lorries or other traffic, something to consider if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, it is all.”
Reviews.Author: FridaPoulsen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days at this hotel. Travel company recommended it. The best thing you can say about the hotel is its location in the city where everything happens. Close to restaurants, art galleries, shopping and transportation. Enrolment was friendly and quick. We requested a quiet room, it was clean and spacious. The bed was good and there was a real duvet and duvet cover. But otherwise a very sparse and bad decor. We are two older, but fully mobile people of 60 and 67, yet it is not enough with only one chair in the room! We used the free internet a lot. Fortunately we do not see much television when we're on holiday. One thing is that the sound and the picture was bad on television, but when one of us sat on the only chair in the room and worked at the desk, it was physically impossible to watch television. The TV was positioned to the left of the bed behind the desk and chair, and remote control starter was attached to the headboard with approximately 50 cm wire! The bathroom was very inconvenient with no storage space, and the bath was an old high bathtubs you had to climb in. All around the bathtub was a disgusting shower curtains that clung to your body when you took a shower. Det var i sept, så temperaturen var passende. Jeg så ingen aircon, kun en lydløs vifte i loftet. There were no coffee / tea making facilities and no fridge in the room. No restaurant. No breakfast. However, there was free coffee down in the foyer. We will not stay here again as the hotel is not suitable for the elderly. And there can not be awarded more stars to a 1 - 2 .Too bad, because the staff in the foyer was very friendly and helpful. Hotel owner should see to decorate the room more practical, because there was enough space.

Reviews.Title: “Old and dated in good location”
Reviews.Author: chocolate85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently (thankfully only for 3 nights). The hotel is in a good location around Union Square, however it is very dated. I did not have high expectations of this hotel - I had seen the photos when we booked, so I certainly wasn't expecting The Ritz. However I was disappointed when we arrived, the property was even more dated than I had expected: There is only one elevator servicing a 10 storey hotel - we would often walk up the stairs as we got sick of waiting so long, there is no A/C in the rooms - only a ceiling fan, we were on the 2nd floor and it was too noisy to open the windows, entry to your room is still by a turn key - the lock on our room was so difficult to open and the door would jam each time, tv made a buzzing noise. On the plus side the hotel seemed clean, staff were friendly, free wifi and the towel animals on the bed each day were cute. I wouldn't stay here again - far too dated for me.

Reviews.Title: “A well-located hotel in Downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: suedebicycle
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Baldwin at 11pm, the front door was locked and the receptionist was reluctant to let us in. Eventually he relented. The room was compact but clean and comfortable. The TV remote control was attached by a cable and velcro to the side table. The best thing about the hotel is its location on Grant Avenue, right next to the entrance to Chinatown and a few minutes walk from Union Square. If you're not intending to spend a lot of time in your room it is a reasonable value and well-located place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jotravy
Reviews.Content: Old hotel, was very clean and nicely located. We could walk to union square in 5 minutes, china town in 1 minute, and to pier 39 in half an hour or less. North beach (little Italy) was a scenic walk through china town in 15 minutes. Everything was very clean. Bed was small and tv hummed, but was a good nights sleep with a cool view. All we wanted and more for what was paid. A great value.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: henrybmn
Reviews.Content: When I booked this, the price was low so I was expecting something sort of marginal in terms of comfort and cleanliness, but I was wonderfully surprised. I had a great room with a comfortable bed and beautiful bathroom. I'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Froniga73
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in 3 different hotels during our trip to San Francisco and this was the first. The location was ideal for exploring: right opposite the Chinatown Gate (San Fran has the largest Chinatown outside of China) and easy walking distance to North Beach (lots of good restaurants and bars), Nob Hill & the big shops at Union Square. The room was a good size: our twin room had 2 double-beds. Like so many mid-range hotels in San Fran, it didn’t serve breakfast, but did have free tea/coffee facilities and had some great cafes and diners nearby. And look out for the towel sculpture: each evening we returned to a different creature made out of towels awaiting us in our room!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for chinatown and union square”
Reviews.Author: goonilla
Reviews.Content: we chose the baldwin hotel for our 4 days stay in san francisco. the location was excellent for sightseeing. it is very close to chinatown, union square and the cable cars. our room was very clean and very silent. it was big enough for two people. decent closet space,(with iron and iron table) a desk and a reasonable number of drawers. excellent wi-fi. (you need to ask the concierge for the password) bathroom with bath/shower. water pressure was always good despite an annoying sound from the faucet (when using hot water). powerful blow dryer. i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: Bradscott
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel in a great location 2 minutes from transport, bars, restaurants and China Town. Room was good size; bathroom was small but more than adequate. Would certainly recommend anyone to stop here. Free Wifi throughtout and free tea & coffee in reception too.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location!”
Reviews.Author: atlmichelle4571
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research for a hotel within our budget in San Francisco and was glad to find this little gem so well reviewed on Trip Advisor. We had a very pleasant stay. The location was by far the best part since it was right smack in the center of everything we wanted to see. My husband and I walked almost the entire city from this location. The price was the biggest draw for us and although the room was very basic, it had everything we needed including a very nice bathroom and comfortable bed. The maids also do the cutest towel animals each day. Our biggest complaint and reason I did not give this hotel 5 stars is the street noise. I was SO excited to get a nice city view when we first entered the room and we slept very well both Friday and Saturday nights. Sunday night however, we were awoken TWICE by banging, screeching, beeping garbage trucks going down a nearby alley. Two different sets cleaned the dumpsters that night and this took 1 hour each time they came....(no idea why two separate trucks came and did the same thing). So after that evening we figured the dumpsters were empty and we wouldn't have to deal with it again since they didn't come on Friday or Saturday so we didn't ask to change rooms. But we were wrong. They came again and did the same thing our remaining two nights. So in retrospect....I absolutely recommend this hotel for location, price and a comfortable room, but request a room on the back side of the hotel to have a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: SomervilleSays
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again. I booked here after all the hotels near the conference I was attending filled up, and I really wasn't sure what I was getting -- I don't know the city at all and had no idea what type of hotel certain price points would provide. On top of all this, I was traveling alone and definitely wanted to make sure I was in a safe, well-trafficked area for a solo woman traveler. Well, it turns out this hotel is in a great neighborhood that's safe and populated at night, with good shopping to boot. It was a 5-7 minute walk to Market Street and the Moscone Center, and even closer to the subway. The style of the hotel is boutique, so you have old-style windows, no AC and no gym, but that's not what you're looking for if you stay somwhere like the Baldwin Hotel. It has nice ceiling fans, comfortable beds, clean & modern bathrooms, and high ceilings. You also get wi-fi and there is a printing kiosk in the lobby. I'd beware if you have children with you, though, that there are no screens on the windows -- they open right up to the air outside! Also, the doors to both the hotel and the rooms have old-fashioned locks, so no key cards here. That may be off-putting to some people. Overall the value was very good here and I would absolutely consider staying here again if I come back for a touristy trip with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: luizclaudiotp
Reviews.Content: Worth the money - decent room, good service and great localization.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mikepro
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 double beds. Room is on the small side, but very adequate. Location is great! In Union Square area, just outside the gates to China Town. Nice french cafe across the street for breakfast/dinner. Or, hot bagel sandwich place around the corner, or 7/11 for yogurt and fresh fruit. (I hate eating heavy breakfasts on vacation). Also, for getting around TAKE THE MUNICIPAL TRANSPORTATION!! Walk down Grant about 2 or 3 blocks to 3rd and Market for the F-line trolly. This will take you to Fisherman's Wharf and out to Castro district. Explore Castor and then catch a 33 bus (on 18th street near where you got off the F-line). Get at Haight & Ashbury. Explore the hippie district. From there, catch the westbound 71 bus to the edge of golden gate park, 19th & Lincoln. Catch the 28 or 29 bus at 19th Avenue and take this to the Golden Gate Bridge Toll Plaza. Enjoy the iconic views of the bridge. You can keep going from here. One thing that surprised me, was that my transfer worked all day on all the busses! So, you can construct an awesome tour of the city, and get around all for the whopping price of $2 on public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a union square stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelor1962
Reviews.Content: The baldwin, is a short walk from the montgomery bart stop,very economical to ride from sfo. Hotel staff was very nice, my room was on 8th floor and very quiet. Location was great to the shopping and sites of union square and only a block or two to the gates of chinatown. Tour companies will do free pickups at hotel also. I walked from hotel to fisherman wharf on Sunday am and if you get on columbus ave will see some great places to dine in north beach. Would stay at the baldwin again, it was almost half the price of many other hotels in the area on labor day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience not luxury”
Reviews.Author: kventures
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend one night in SF on our way to Sanoma.if you want luxury This is not it! The noise od the the trucks backing up will be there late at night and early morn! The amenities didnt work well i.e our iron! The humming of the tv is beyond annoying.. However The staff was very nice and you will be located next to china town and many other stores and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Good Value”
Reviews.Author: suz2go
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baldwin Hotel for 3 nights in August 2011. The location was great, the price was reasonable, the room was super clean and the staff were very friendly, patient, and helpful. There is 24 hour in and out parking a few blocks away which costs and additional 31 dollars. It's an incredible bargain for San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Minfra
Reviews.Content: A good, lower middle class hotel at the edge of China Town. At walking distance from a BART station (train to SF International). No breakfast served. At checking in, we were asked to pay 100 dollar that we would get back at checking out. The hotel room was already paid in advance. We have stayed over the years in many hotels in Europe, Amerika, Mexico and North Africa, but this was the first time that we had to pay such a deposit (for possible damage to the room?). Quite unsympathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great price, would use it again”
Reviews.Author: PassportUK
Reviews.Content: We checked out of here this morning. We are a family of 4 adults on this trip with 2 bedrooms. The hotel was easy to find, and right near the gates to China Town. Also right next to Union Square. Superb location. In the lobby there are plenty of leaflets on attractions and some coupons! At the far end of the lobby there is a small lounge area, with snack vending machines, and complimentary tea and coffee. My parents stayed in room 602, a double room overlooking the main street and you could see the gates to China Town. We were in room 606, with a view of the side street but prefered our bathroom to theirs as we had an old fashioned bath. In the room there is no air con but the ceiling fan is very good. There is flat screen TV. There is an iron and board in every room and a safe. There is no kettle but free tea and coffee downstairs. There is free WiFi ask reception for the code, it's very reliable and fast. Our rooms were spacious enough for us and were very clean. Can't ask for much more. There is a Starbucks less than 30 seconds from the hotel if you want a fancy hot drink and snack.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: StefanLsweden
Reviews.Content: A good and affordable hotel with a perfect location near the Chinatown gate. Rooms are quite small but clean and nice. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: youngConnoisseur
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at Baldwin Hotel. The location was perfect! The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom is a little small. There was only a small pedestal sink, so the lack of counter space was a tad inconvenient. For the price, we would definitely stay here again. We did not have any issue with noise. We could open our window, which was nice, and there was a ceiling fan.

Reviews.Title: “It was such a nice stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: SilvinoLCSilva
Reviews.Content: All the hotel people were quite friendly and helpful, the bedroom were very nice and kept clean everyday... outstanding location... I really recommend this hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Adequate Amenity”
Reviews.Author: zacstar
Reviews.Content: OK, let's be fair...this is not the Ritz. If you are expecting any WOW factor put it aside. This is a basic hotel in a historic building in a very central location but it doesnt come with bells and whistles. It was a perfect base, and the only real critism would be that the tv made a humming noise and therefore difficult to watch as we wound down at night. Front desk staff are EXCELLENT!! Knew everything about the city and transport and were only too willing to help.....great work guys!! Our initial reaction to the room was that it was small and rudimentary, but only after being spoilt in other pricier rooms in other cities on our trip. Friends were staying around the corner at a much more expensive hotel and had a smaller room than us! So for a San Francisco hotel it was value for money for an almost European hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in safe central area”
Reviews.Author: Damian1974
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the foot of Chinatown gateway on a main street within walking distance to the many shops & restaurants at Union Square. Front desk staff are very knowledgeable of San Fran & incredibly polite & helpful. Whilst the hotel is old & and the rooms very small (reminiscent of a western European hotel), they are clean & the bed very comfy. Ultimately, for the price we paid this hotel provided excellent value for money. Area couldn't be safer. Just don't expect anything flash & you won't be disappointed. Weren't disrupted by any noise as we stayed on 11th floor towards the back. Excellent, fast free wifi in room. Many thanks Baldwin. Ps- Alcatraz tour is a must do which you need to book in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: wuppertaler
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced hotel that has a prime location in downtown San Francisco. It's literally steps from Chinatown, only a few blocks from the cable cars and Union Square, and about 1/2 mile from the Ferry Building. The rooms are small but well maintained and fairly quiet (we were on the 8th floor). Not a lot of amenities to speak of, but then again, we were out exploring the city all day. All in all, we'd stay there again because the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Pashtida
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great deal given the combination of price and location. It's right near the Chinatown gate, in a safe and walkable neighborhood, with plenty of restaurants and shops (and Chinatown) within a short walking distance. The rooms are very basic. They are clean and in a good shape, but they don't have microwave or refrigerator. The hotel doesn't have guest laundry service (you need to walk up a steep hill to the laundromat), they don't have the option for a roll-away bed, and they charge 10$ a day for a crib. There are no coffee making facilities in the hotel at all. In short, you get what you pay for and nothing more. The staff, mostly very young, were all nice and polite, but indifferent and inattentive to guests needs. I would stay there again, due to the great location, but would know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “I don't recommend”
Reviews.Author: Hpena
Reviews.Content: TV was broken, ice machine only in first floor, no A/C.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Trip-Monkey-Girl
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin Hotel was clean and tidy and conveniently placed at the entrance to Chinatown. The room was a good size as was the ensuite (and the ensuite had natural light). The bed was comfortable and this would have all been lovely if it had not been so noisy. I had read other reviews on Trip Advisor and they had mentioned the noise but because of the location I decided to take a risk – it didn’t pay off. Probably if we had stayed in one of the rooms at the back of the hotel we may not have had the same issues but unfortunately if seemed as if there were trucks up and down the street outside our window all night. An investment in some double glazing would not go amiss.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: DM85
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Baldwin Hotel in June 2011. The best aspect of this hotel was the location. You could see the gates to China Town from our room and in the opposite direction are all the shops you could wish for! It was a 2 minute walk to Union Square and all in all we loved the location. The actual room itself was very clean but small. The decor was modern and bright.
