The room came well equipped with a walk in type wardrobe and a set of drawers, TV, free safe, hairdryer (hiding in a drawer.) We had asked for 2 beds but only got one double, which was not ideal but okay. The bathroom was also clean. There was no free wifi which we were disappointed in. You also had to pay to use the computer in reception if you wanted to print out your boarding pass etc. We booked a shuttle back to the airport from the reception which was easy and cheaper than getting a taxi. We liked the towel animals that were left on the bed each day (what can I say, we are easily amused!) It was also very refreshing to have a table with a mirror and some plugs near-by for drying hair and straightening/curling hair/ getting ready to go out. The amount of hotels which seem to forget to put a plug near the mirror! One night the radiator (or the pipes or something) were banging really loudly for 30 mins to 45 mins when we were trying to sleep which was annoying. Well we thought it was annoying, until it stopped and all we could hear was a violinist playing the same 2 songs over and over again outside the hotel! But this luckily was only one night. You do sometimes get some noise at the weekend from the bars nearby. I would recommend the Baldwin hotel, as it is clean, comfortable with a great location. It seems that it is standard to have fairly small rooms in San Francisco (when i was reading reviews for other hotels). If the decor had been dingy the room would have felt very depressing, but as it was so light and modern, the room was pleasant. The price of the room was also very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service, rooms were fine”
Reviews.Author: taostraveler2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and found the Baldwin to be a great location for access to Chinatown, Union Square and the cable cars. The price was reasonable for the summer, much less than Fisherman's Wharf, and many fine restaurants are nearby. The Ferry Building was only a 15 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Access to everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Patspeedy88
Reviews.Content: Clean Room, great location. Secure and safe for women traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful towel animals”
Reviews.Author: Trevorzzz999
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was clean and comfortable and convenient for the city. We wished we had checked out the parking arrangements in advance. The beggars around the streets detracted from the experience. The towel animals are works of art!

Reviews.Title: “Great, inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamais17
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Baldwin Hotel in March of 2011. This is a no-frills hotel in the heart of downtown San Francisco. It is literally a one-minute walk from the gate to Chinatown. The staff was very friendly. We were able to leave our luggage with them for hours before check-in time. The rooms are nothing special, but very clean and comfortable. Some of the bathrooms have old clawfoot tubs which add a nice touch. Prior to our stay at this hotel we stayed for four nights at the Nikko Hotel. This four star property will not see us again. The Baldwin, on the other hand, remains on our list for San Francisco. I can recommend it to anyone who seeks inexpensive and clean accomodation in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: jenchamb
Reviews.Content: Nice location and very, very clean. Great price. Close to Chinatown and Union Square shopping. The only issue we had is that when we called for info over the phone, one rooms with one bed were left and we have an older child, we were told we could have a cot for her. When we got there we were told they only have cribs, no roll aways. So that was a bit of an issue as we were travelling with others and really needed a cot in each room. There were no other rooms available so the kids had to sleep on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “great spot”
Reviews.Author: ballaboo
Reviews.Content: great location - easy walking distance to union square cable car, chinatown, and many other locations. Room was not huge, but perfectly adequate, clean, and functional. The hand towels folded into animal shapes was a nice little touch. Other have commented on noise, but if you're on a main street in a major city, just what do you expect? We'd recommend the Baldwin to any friends going to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great room”
Reviews.Author: KariC_11
Reviews.Content: We loved our room. It was clean, quaint and as quiet as you can get in San Fran. Our room backed to the alley so we did have a bit of a barrier between us and the street noise. The location was absolutely perfect. We were half a block from the bargains in China Town. One block away from the buses and cable cars. We stayed 4 nights and hated to leave our little "home away from home."

Reviews.Title: “Good value & great location”
Reviews.Author: sallylass
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Baldwin at the begining of our fly drive holiday. Although the facilities are fairly basic the staff were friendly, the room nice and clean and the bed very comfy. We spent most of our time out and about seeing the sights and wanted somewhere affordable, central and clean - so for us the hotel was ideal. If you're after somewhere with it's own facilities (restaurant, pool, bar etc) then this isn't it but if you're after somewhere to comfy to sleep after a day exploring the city then I heartily recommend the Baldwin.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: kaalaearoad
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a very good location, right outside the gates of Chinatown and walking distance to Union Square. The room was one of the cleanest that we've stayed in. Drawbacks were the noisy cable television, flaky WiFi and the lack of air-conditioning. The weather in SF is cool enough so there isn't a need for ac but having the windows open does let the traffic noise in. Guest must realize that this hotel is an older building and like other older SF hotels the room is on the small size and there is only one elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Sportsguy61
Reviews.Content: I attended a seminar at a nearby hotel. However, I stayed at the Baldwin Hotel and saved over $100 per night. I consider the Baldwin to be an exceptional value. The location is ideal and I wish to especially recognize the maid staff as my room was consistently very clean throughout my stay. I have stayed at a number of hotels, and based upon what I have observed the Baldwin Hotel has one of the better maid staffs. I was very pleased that I opted to stay at the Baldwin Hotel during my visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lishixin
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel. Although it is not cheap and the room is pretty small but it has pretty much everything I need. The frontdesk is polite and helpful. Free coffee is provided in the lobby 24 hours per day. Most importantly, its location is prefect. China Town, BART station, Union Square are all just blocks away. There is also a 7/11 nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Small, older hotel that's been neatly refreshed.”
Reviews.Author: BCIcan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located, adequately priced and clean. The rooms were very small; typical of older hotels. Though small, it was no more, or less than I needed for a week long stay for business. I liked the fact there was no stale cigarette smoke odor anywhere in the hotel and it was very clean, especially for an older hotel. The staff was always very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: maziedaisy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our trip though California with another couple both celebrating our 10th anniversary. We were very impressed. We arrived 2 hours earlier than check-in but they allowed us to check in to one of the rooms. Our second room was ready at 4 on the dot. Both rooms were very clean and comfortable. We were able to walk everywhere in San Francisco. It was about 5-10 minute walk to Union Square,and about 25 minutes to AT&T stadium. We also walked to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiardelli Square but not directly so I can't give times. The hotel was very clean and rooms were crisp and comfortable. Both rooms had claw foot tubs. Each afternoon a clean towel was folded into a fun animal or shape and left on the bed. We had a little problem with our shower curtain which we notified the front desk of. We went out for a quick walk and the curtain had already been replaced by the time we returned. I felt for the price, this was an awesome hotel. I already recommended it to my sister who is coming in town for the marathon this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 01Freckles
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location right by the gateway to Chinatown and a very short walk to all the shops at Union Square. Hotel room was fine. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, well furnished, comfortable, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pippaskippa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, really well located just off Union Square and close to Chinatown. Staff were always helpful and advice about parking was really useful (and accurate). Room was well furnished and clean. Only negatives were no air conditioning, but had a ceiling fan which worked ok but not as cool as air conditioning. Occassionally noisy at night so had to keep windows shut. Would definitely stay there again overall

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, safe”
Reviews.Author: Cromagnon53
Reviews.Content: A good centrally located hotel for seeing the city. Friendly staff, comfortable rooms and beds, clean bathrooms, good value. Quiet, despite the number of occupiers. Good sized rooms with big windows, but off the street, so not noisy. My only small gripe was the cost to use their PC at $10 an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, renovated rooms, that's OK.”
Reviews.Author: tuzunengin
Reviews.Content: Location is very good. Near the Market Street, Union Square and Chinatown. Old hotel but renovated rooms, it's clean. Staff is very helpful. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel on our whole trip”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMaes
Reviews.Content: We first got room 401 which is located on the main street but the noise was so much we could not sleep all night! It's like the windows were still open. We requested another room (807) which was a little better but still quite noisy. All rooms are small to very small and their king bed seemed to be just a queen. The staff is VERY unfriendly and even rude, don't expect to get much more than a grunt as a response. The location is OK, a few blocks from union square where some public transport is located. On our trip we stayed in 14 other (lower-priced) hotels (including New York City, Washington DC) and every single one of them was A LOT better... I would certainly NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. Tip: avoid their 14$/day charge for internet and go to the starbucks close by at the chinatown gate for your internet needs.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: brittania_11
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. It was close to my conference at the Moscone Center and was on the gate of Chinatown-- perfect for sight-seeing. Every day, the towels would be folded up like origami on the bed (a snail, puppy, etc); such a nice personal touch. The clawfoot tub was nice, too. This hotel had so much more personality than a standard chain hotel. If I go back to San Francisco, I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to city attractions but not many amenities”
Reviews.Author: Gerr201175
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the affordable price and the convenience.There were great and not so great points of the Baldwin Hotel. The location was great-- just a block from the Chinatown gate and very centrally located to many attractions. Also the bus and cable cars were just a couple blocks away. There were some good restaurant options and shopping close as well. The parking was offsite and $30 a day, so given that we didn't end up really needing the car, I felt that was a waste. The room was very small, but it was clean had a pretty nice view. The room had a ceiling fan, but the bed was pretty hard. We tried the room service, and we were not fans. So all in all, this hotel was affordable and convenient. It is best if you don't have a car (you don't really need one in SF proper) and you don't need a lot of amenities. The staff was very nice and friendly. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Rafikijo
Reviews.Content: Room was small but very, very clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. TV audio was terrible. Couldn't regulate the temperature except by opening the window. Shower was excellent and bed reasonably comfy. Garbage trucks noise was horrible during the night if you're not used to such. Hotel is 1/2 block away from Chinatown and a couple of blocks from the MUNI/BART, excellent location. Overall very worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Really nothing negative can be said about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hansamdam
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, and have no reason for any complaints at all. The service provided was excellent and the hotel was well located to shops, restaurants, Chinatown etc. I most definitely will recommend this hotel when friends of mine go to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Clara-Tito
Reviews.Content: One block from the entrance to Chinatown, this small hotel is very comfortable and very clean. The staff are friendly and accommodating. The hotel was very inexpensive. The beds were comfortable and the shower was excellent. There are some very nice restaurants in the area and it is close to wonderful shopping. We couldn't have asked for a nicer long weekend. We will definitely take our next one at the Baldwin.

Reviews.Title: “excellant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kingyEngland
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the baldwin for 3 nights and found the hotel lived up to all the good reviews that you read on trip adviser. the room we had was a large room,in good condition, good sized bathroom with an old fashioned role top bath (lovely). a flat screen tv with many channels on that you can watch when you wake up at stupider oclock due to jet lag. The hotel is in an excellant position for shopping. the bus/trams are in easy walking distance (10 mins away) and r easy to work out, these then lead you to all the sights. The hotel also has a coffee and tea making machine in the foyer which is handy when you need a cupa in the morning. I would highly recommend this hotel. this hotel was the start of a trip round california if u are doing the same and need any recomendations for hotels in yosemeti, santa barbara, LA, san diego, vegas you will find them in my trip adviser account or you can email me through trip adviser.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: RSW82
Reviews.Content: this was a great hotel for the cost. The location is great and we walked everywhere. It is incredibly clean and yes, the towel animals are amazing. It is fantastic value for money with lovely services. Would stay there again and recommend! for a couple the room was ample size, comfy bed, lovely en suite bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: ZellV
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend it if you're looking for a no-frills, clean, convenient place on a budget, especially if you're traveling alone like me. I went in early May and booked online in advance, so I got a rate of about $100/night, which is pretty good considering it's right in downtown SF. The trains and cable cars are a few minutes' walk away. It's right between Union Square and Chinatown so you can do your shopping and hunt down some cheap and good grub in one trip (try looking on Stockton St., one block west). The staff is polite and helpful. The TV reception wasn't great, but who spends their vacation cooped up in front of the TV anyway? Grant St. is not very busy at night so things do quiet down then. You may still hear some ambient noise outside but you could try asking for a room toward the back if that's a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: misablue
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in this lovely clean hotel for 4 nights in May. Hotel is in best location possible, right by gate to Chinatown and all great restaurants, and less than 5 minute walk to Union Square and Market street. Everyday we kept saying how glad we are that we chose hotel in this location! Our room was on 4th floor facing the Grant Avenue, room was clean, spacious double with clean bathroom. There was also big cupboard for clothes, suitcases and with safe. Reception staff always happy to help. Exceeded all our expectations. Amazing, would come back any time, great value for money! Better than some 3 star hotels we stayed in. There are coffee& tea facilities on the ground floor by reception. For breakfast we went to TacoBel on Market street, cheap breakfast buritos :-) Only one minus is Wi-Fi charge of $9 per day, but there is Starbucks couple houses up, so went there to check our emails etc. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “best user-friendly and cheap stay”
Reviews.Author: mgermain70
Reviews.Content: We went at the Baldwin hotel for 5 nights at the end of april. 53.00 dollars per night downtown San Francisco!!!! Excellent location, a lot of restaurants (chinese, italian, vietnamese, cafe etc..) at walking distance. We read the reviews before going, and I was a bit worry about the noise at night because I'm a light sleeper. I brought ear plugs and guess what: I slept all night without any problems! It's probably because of all the walking and biking we did during the day that did help a bit.... But anyway, the rooms are extra clean, just the perfect size for our needs(if you're used to the presidential suites,change hotel!). It's close Chinatown, cable cars, Westfield center, Bart station. We even walk to the AT&T park(20 minutes) and pier 39(30 minutes). At the front desk, poople are always friendly and they have city map that we used a lot during our visit. I would return again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyPortmacquarie
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at the Baldwin for 3 nights. The location is fantastic and the rooms were lovely and well renovated. It is very economical to stay here...rooms under $80 at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Poochifur
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights early April based on reviews. This hotel cannot be beaten on value for money due to it's location. Right next to Chinatown, 20 min walk to the bay, 5 min walk to shops and transport links. Reception were helpful and housekeeping good. The only think that let it down was the basic room. So basic in fact that we weren't able to turn off the heating as apparently it's on a system and as it was 70 degrees during our stay it meant we had to keep the window open = noisy, uncomfortable and not much sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: daz2397
Reviews.Content: Great location near UNION SQUARE and just across the road from the CHINATOWN sign. Fishermans wharf only about two miles away, with stunning views. Cycle from pier 41 over the Golden Gate bridge to Sausilito and get ferry back, a bit pricey but good experience. Good irish bar callled the irish bank less then 100 yards from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug201041
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Great price, comfortable large room with good bathroom. Cleaned every day and very quite at night. For the price we could not have asked for more. Friendly and helpful staff. Most importantly, LOCATION. It is very easy to come unstuck in San Fran and be taken in by the "central location" of certain places, only to arrive and realise you are actually staying in the middle of hell. Not the case with the Baldwin. It is on the other side of Union Square to the homeless/druggy chaos, a short stroll to the shops and Bart/bus stops and very safe. Would highly recommend to anyone who would prefer to spend their money on clothes rather than hotel bills but does not want to rough it either.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location....”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_CAN
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, very close to Chinatown and Union Sq. Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are small but clean. I read some previous reviews but I did not experiecnce any problems. I would recommend this hotel for people on budget and who don't need any special luxuries. No free internet ($9 per day) but go to Starbucks and you'll get one free.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: seacat123
Reviews.Content: The check in at the Baldwin hotel was smooth, Reception staff very helpful with their knowledge of area and events. Rooms comfy and the bath nice but shower pressure just ok. Maid service is very good. The area is excellent and at the gate of Chinatown. Plenty of shops in the area and they have coffee available 24 hours in the lobby. Overall I would recommend to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok value for money”
Reviews.Author: LittleSnuffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The location was good, close to Chinatown. The rooms were small and stuffy and the linen was itchy but they were clean. Overall it was fairly good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay at the Baldwin Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: louise30709
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. I have stayed at higher end hotels in San Francisco and really like this one more. The location could not have been better, and the staff were very friendly. A great hotel for the money!

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast in San Francisco and the Baldwin was the perfect place to stay for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: tddoyle4
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin was affordable, clean, comfortable and friendly. It's location between Chinatown and Union Square and close to Cable Car lines made it the perfect place to venture out each morning to where ever we wanted to go. It was also very easy to come back to the hotel in between excursions to change, rest, etc. Good places to eat within a very short distance, Chinatown a brief walk away - it was really a terrific stay in San Francisco and we were so pleased with our choice of the Baldwin Hotel! One small suggestion - don't make the lobby coffee so darn strong!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and value”
Reviews.Author: mulder2112
Reviews.Content: Good sized room, with plenty storage. Clean and in a great location, I had no problems with the hotel at all for the nights I was there. Good value, and although a little basic in places, was ideal for a comfortable and peaceful base. Wifi was fine, although not free. Plenty places to eat nearby. Friendly front desk staff. Would be happy to return next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Cost Effective”
Reviews.Author: suitscase
Reviews.Content: This year we enjoyed a spring break time away in California. Had wanted to visit San Francisco for some time and the Jackson Browne Concert in Santa Cruz gave us the excuse to see this part of North America. We found the Baldwin using trip advisor and when we called to book the rooms found out they were offering a fantastic low-season rate on the rooms. Yes the previous reviews were right – it is a noisy place being right in the middle of Union Square and steps from the Chinatown Gate. Since it is a 100 year old Californian building the windows and only single pane glass and do not block out much sound. As well we were in room 901 and I think all the 01 rooms are right by the elevator shaft. It is an old elevator and the cables rattle which is heard in the room. But as I have mentioned in other reviews – I travel with ear plugs to help me sleep and the man who sleeps beside me could nap through Dim Sum so we were fine. I think the rooms at the back of the hotel are quieter. The room was an adequate size, but really we do not spend a lot of time in the rooms when we travel. Bed nice and comfortable, new flat screen TV to watch if you want to spend travel time watching tv ;-) Only thing the room was missing was a second chair which would have been useful when we brought “home” the pizza to eat in the room! Staff were helpful, great restaurant recommendations and Uncle Vito’s Pizza just south of the hotel is worth a visit. We enjoyed the coffee and hot water for tea that was in the small sitting area just off the lobby. Only basic black tea so if you like some herbal tea before bed bring your own teabags! A good idea to bring your own mug too since all they have is Styrofoam cups. The WiFi was a horrid price at $9 a day. I just wandered down to the green and white Seattle based Coffee monopoly and bought some tea and used their internet each evening (being cheap, and inventive I saved the mug for the morning coffee . . . hate Styrofoam!) The location is one of the best parts of this hotel. You are a few blocks from the BART so can just take the train in from the airport. And you are a short 3-4 block walk to the main bus routes, trams, cable cars, and walking distance to the waterfront. Wear comfortable shoes and don’t bother renting a car – no where to park it anyhow!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Good Value for your money near the Chinatown entrance”
Reviews.Author: C_Los52970
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased by this hotel. I paid about $52/night in February. Great value for the money and it was near the Chinatown entrance. Furthermore it was located a short walking distance from Union Square and all the glitzy stores. I was early for my check-in and I was able to leave my luggage with them while I attended a conference. The hotel is very clean. Each day the housekeeper left a cute animal design-made from towels-on my bed. The bathroom was always cleaned. The front desk people were very helpful. As a matter of fact one of the front desk ladies booked for me an Alcatraz tour while I waited for a tour bus to pick me up. They also booked a shuttle bus to take me to the airport at the time of check-out. One negative was that the cable tv had limited channels and the reception was fuzzy at times--but who comes to San Francisco to watch tv!? The other thing is that the hotel does not have a microwave, so if you plan to heat some food you will not be able to. Oh, and you have to pay for internet connection. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, central location, walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: yo_yao_11_ming
Reviews.Content: Nice hosts, hassle free check in. Spacious room (for 1), clean bathroom, secure and safe Excellent location, 20 minutes to the chinatown gate!, short distance to trams to take you everywhere else Best - No problems at all with the hotel or staff!! Worst - being from Australia, not used to the constant sound of sirens at night (is that a san fran thing?) In summary, i would highly recomment this hotel to fellow travellers

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very reasonable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: smithdat
Reviews.Content: This hotel didn't have all the bells and whistles of the Hilton, Omni, or Westin hotels, but it got the job done. Nice clean rooms, soft comfortable beds, and incredibly reasonable prices and friendly staff. My only gripe was with the television service, it was just not very good reception. Oh and the bathroom fan was loud. Other than those two things, it was pretty close to perfect. I will be staying there again when I visit the Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Teacherbear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ver well located and offers great value for the money. The rooms are small but functional. The tv is no wide screen but ok. The room we had , had a very large closet which wass super everything could be put in it. The bathroom was good. The elevator is a bit slow. Check in staff were super and very helpful in all regards. There is. O breakfaast jsut coffee

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: diana67111
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about finding a safe, reasonably priced hotel room in downtown San Francisco but the Baldwin Hotel was better than I expected. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. The location was great with Union Square and Market Street and access to cable cars, street cars, buses and BART within a short walk. (not to mention the South Gate to Chinatown just across the street) The room was simple but updated with a big screen TV and a safe for valuables in the closet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: likestotravePatty
Reviews.Content: I would definately recommend this hotel. Have been visiting for many years on day trips, but treated three 18 year old girls for their Birthday so we spend the weekend. Plenty of room for all of us. The lobby and rooms were nice and clean especially the bathroom which had plenty of nice towels. Comfortable bed and great pillows. Hotel staff very friendly! Parking was not bad for the price which you have to pay for anyway when staying for the day. Great Place overall and for breakfast on the cheap there is a Starbucks next door and Subway 1/2 block. China Gate is right there, Union Square 2 blocks away along w/the cable cars. Overall very nice updated condition for an older hotel in a big city. I am looking forward for another stay here in the future

Reviews.Title: “My default San Francisco hotel for my next trip!”
Reviews.Author: soochie
Reviews.Content: Firstly, talk about nearby amenities around the hotel walking distance to BART (Although I ride once) walking distance to Sear's Diners! and Chinatown! walking distance to Union Square! walking distance to the garage where I parked my car! walking distance to a mini mart (turn left after starbucks)! Secondly, talk about the hotel itself accommodating and friendly staff! ask them questions, they will glady help. safe vicinity, no beggars, no dirty places or clubs quiet area/street, I do not know why some reviews mentioned noisy street. clean room, no bugs no smell!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Angel250580
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. We had a room on the 6th floor that was clean and quiet. The organization of the room was strange, the TV was not in front of the bed. The personnel is ok. Overall the price is really good and the quality as well. No breakfast available.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Allexya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, there is no need for anyone to drive because everything is very close to it. The negatives are that it has no breakfast and no internet. The hotel is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Steve631
Reviews.Content: It was only $70 per night for a single room with queen bed since I booked a few months in advance. Although it's a basic hotel, the location is right outside the main gate to Chinatown and there are lots of places to eat and shop in the immediate area. The maid service and reception were also very good. 10-15 minute walk from the Moscone Center.

Reviews.Title: “Not spectacular but a great deal in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: acerussi
Reviews.Content: I plan to return to this hotel - very good deal in SF. Not far from BART station (5 min walk) or the monscone convention center (10 minute walk). The single rooms are small and the bathroom smaller. no frills here - just the basics. And someone on the cleaning crew did manage to leave towels shaped as animals - sort of origami - and it was delightful. front office was helpful. high-speed wireless internet available for a reasonable fee. I might not recommend the place for families unless you get multiple rooms, but if you are a single business traveler you might be hard pressed to find a better deal in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler43
Reviews.Content: Great location at a great price! Close enough to walk to lots of placesand close to transit lines. It is noisy, but that's to be expected in the middle of a densely packed city. Rooms are clean, bathrooms sparkle. We've stayed at the Baldwin three times. The room is basic and our TV had a buzzing noise, but if you're out and about enjoying San Francisco, those are very minor issues. There's a Starbucks almost next door.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't change the sheets”
Reviews.Author: spike024
Reviews.Content: The room appeared to be very clean and the bathroom was very clean but I don't believe they changed the sheet before I arrived. There was evidence.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: coconewbie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steps to China Town and the great shopping in Union Square. If you are a walker, like myself, it was close enough to North Beach, Little Italy, The Bart, The Muni, and of coarse the Starbucks located two doors down. The customer service was superb, rooms were cozy, cute and comfortable. They do not offer room service but they do provide a menu to have food delivered so thats nice.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect find for us”
Reviews.Author: leemarie73
Reviews.Content: We did not know what to expect when we booked The Baldwin but were very surprised when we checked in. The room was small but very nicely kept, clean and had everything we needed. Our view was amazing. The bathroom was small but cute cute cute! It was not near the wharf but a short cab ride to the wharf. Walking distance through China Town and Union Square. The staff was friendly and accommodated us immediately when i requested extra blankets. All in all I would stay her again.. Nice, clean and very accomodateing.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: FG100
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel from other peoples reviews and it was even better than I had hoped for. The location can't be beat, it is minutes walk away from Union Square and all the shops. You can also walk to Fishermans Wharf, which is about a mile away, although with the hills a taxi is easier. The rooms are great, looked newly refurbished with a lovely bathroom, comfortable bed, tv. They are not huge rooms, but are big enough to feel comfy. The hotel is very quiet, again great considering its right in the city. The hotel does not have any facilities, but if you are just looking for a great comfortable base to explore the city it is perfect. There is internet in reception, which was fairly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, price not so great, similar hoteles for same price...”
Reviews.Author: Evita_1957
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the elevatior smelled like vomit, we mentioned it to the clerk, the stench stayed until we departed on Jan 1, 2011. The carpet should had been removed because it went to the foam underneath it. we asked if they could call us a taxi, they said that taxis do not go to this hotel, why? You have a survey and not a person talking to taxi companies, incredible. The mattresses were horrible, all of us came out with back aches. The noise from the garbage and city was disruptive during the night. Also we had to complain regarding the heating system. The rooms were so hot we were unable to sleep, they kept on saying they would turn it off at midnight. What a waste of energy!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay without car”
Reviews.Author: andanton
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for city sightseeing trip. It's very well located, calm, affordable in price, the staff is very friendly and so on. I cannot say anything negative about this hotel. But its location in the very city center has one serious demerit: no space for parking. We arrived by car, and I returned this car to the Hertz office (which is just 5 minutes away) in the next morning. Ah, one more: internet is not free. I paid $23 for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice deal!”
Reviews.Author: sheynecris
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel... The rooms are clean; the staff is very helpful; the location is perfect (close to Union Square). Surprisingly cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Great central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: suzyqueen_10
Reviews.Content: Good value for money in this centrally located hotel. Staff very helpful, good housekeeping service with a nice, light and very tidy room (I was on Level 10). Only downside was that you had to pay for wireless (around $6-9 per day) - very unusual for San Fran! All in all a great place to stay and even with the wireless cost included it is a great economical option. I caught the BART into the city but arranged for a shuttle back to the airport through the hotel that cost around $15.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and Great location”
Reviews.Author: Johnatthegate
Reviews.Content: The woman and works the day shift was not friendly and the second shift person could not get the ice machine to work.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: AbdulHalim
Reviews.Content: Though the room size is rather small for 3 adults we have an enjoyable stay, will defnitely stay here again when visiting SF

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel less than 1 block from Chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: MrBurritoMan
Reviews.Content: A very charming well staffed hotel right at the foot of Chinatown. Very nice rooms with newer TVs and Windows. Charming working radiators in every room. Less than a block from several affordable and expensive restruants. Small market around the corner that has just about everything. This hotel is an incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Buddytam
Reviews.Content: The people are nice and helpful. Their heater is on for a fixed period. Once I told them I feel cold in the early morning, they ask if I need additional heater. Their services are also efficient and effective. The room is clean and have enough space for the price. Free coffee and tea at the lobby is warm. It located close to China Town and near Union Square and the train stations are very convenience to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “It is good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Lucyleonora
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. Room was smallish with only 1 bedside table by the bed, with the bed pushed up against the wall. Not like indicated in the pictures. However - the room was very clean, had a flat screen television and a very good (albeit quite small) bathroom. The heating system did make rather loud gargling noises throughout the night - which was irritating. However - the location was absolutely fantastic - right in the middle of everything in a great area! Overall - for $60 including tax a night - we'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, decent room”
Reviews.Author: kbs-cc
Reviews.Content: Old building with noisy lights, questionable tv quality, and no free internet. However, it is a great location and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Goo value, but too noise!”
Reviews.Author: McGyverBrasil
Reviews.Content: Great location, good value, clean, confortable. Realy cheaper for the location. But it is too noise because the street and the plumbing inside the room. It was dificulty to sleep well. Another thing that worth to comment: one guy tried to stole us right in front of the hotel! I know this is a safe area, but........ Good hotel to stay 2, or 3 nights at maximum. If you don´t have problem with your budget maybe you would like to try another one.

Reviews.Title: “i loved it”
Reviews.Author: iloveminneapolis
Reviews.Content: its a great place with a perfect location - next to lots of stores and restaurants. I felt very safe in the area at night. I was attending a conference at the Marriott and it was less than a 10 minute walk. My room had also recently been re-done, so the bedding and tv were brand new. I will definitely stay here again. the room cleaning service was also really great. Only bummer? No free wi-fi! That definitely needs to br changed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: marielosCR
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great location, near Market Street, Bart and Muni Stations, cable car stops and of course China Town. The staff was very helpful. We will definetly stay there next time that we go to SF

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: allischarming
Reviews.Content: This is a very well appointed and conveniently located hotel. My room was excellent and quiet considering the location. Easy for all downtown business and entertainment, great shopping just outside. Chinatown is right there, short walk to Moscone or the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Forest4
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four from Australia who stayed for three nights in one room. Hotel was excellent value in a prime location near union square and Chinatown. Rooms not big, but clean and very comfortable. Staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel to explore San Francisco from.”
Reviews.Author: russonthejob
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay at the Baldwin, staff very helpful, hotel always clean and location was perfect. Checked out the hotel on Trip Advisor and thought it would be suitable for us. As it turned out it was better than expected in every way and all at an exellent price. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Baldwin offers an excellent value and a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Gardisky
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin's staff was very helpful and courteous. Their shopping special with free parking is an excellent deal. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The location offers easy access to many areas of the City, yet is in a location that offers some relief from the noise and the crowds. The only problem for us was the elevator was next to our room and was very noisy, but staying downtown in the City is never going to be noise free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmglin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. The hotel is in a great location and close to Chinatown and Union Square. The staff are helpful and the rooms are big for SF standard. My room was very clean and it all looked new. All in all, a great stay and I will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Meeshax
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Baldwin at the beginning of November and we were very pleased by it. The rooms are basic - no artwork on the walls, no real view, on the small side - but they are spotlessly clean, excellent maid service. We also really liked the deep claw-foot bathtub and the big flat screen TV. The rooms are very quiet (as long as you leave the windows closed to keep the city noise out) and the beds are comfortable. The front counter staff were very pleasant and helpful. The location is also very good - central, right next to China Town gate and surrounded by many restaurants (sushi restaurant next door, Starbucks 2 doors down). This hotel is a true value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kiwibc
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin was great. Very central location, staff were helpful, rooms were very clean and spacious. Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good location with some character”
Reviews.Author: 4kiwistravel
Reviews.Content: Location is handy to many San Fran sights. Hotel is in old building so has plenty of character. Clean rooms and friendly front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “This was one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: toodlebug315
Reviews.Content: This is one great hotel! We had never been to San Francisco before and booked the Baldwin Hotel online. Was VERY pleased with it! Staff was very nice in helping us get around the area. Room made you feel like you were back in the 1930's, nothing special just regular hotel but it was one of the cleanest hotel rooms we had ever stayed at! And every day when we came back to the hotel there was an ORAGAMI animal placed on our bed made from a towel which was very special! We would recommend this hotel very highly! Was also close to chinatown, and cable cars, and since I have bad knees that was important!

Reviews.Title: “Safe for solo female traveler”
Reviews.Author: celphilviv
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night, joined a tour, and then returned to the hotel for five straight nights. I have no complaint about the rooms and both were clean with sufficient lighting. The first room faced the street but was right next to the elevator. The second was on a higher floor and quiet. I like the location as the hotel is right between Union Square and China town. It was pretty safe for a solo female traveller. It is almost like a four star hotel but without the perks (swimming pool, exercise room, restaurants, shops). Housekeeping was courteous and discreet. The only problem I encountered is having to wait for almost 20 minutes at the front counter for the person to finish eating his lunch (behind some door). I do miss the exercise room and will probably look for a hotel with one the next time I'm in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mauchi55
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in November. The room charge was so reasonable for the location. 30 seconds to China town and you can reach any place on foot. Many shops and restaurants are close to this hotel. So I think I will come back if I go San Francisco again on business.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Baldwin!”
Reviews.Author: AngelaCharlotteNC
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin is located at the gates of China Town. The location could not be better! This was our third stay at the Baldwin. When we are able to return across the country to San Francisco again, we will stay at the Baldwin!

Reviews.Title: “The price is right”
Reviews.Author: irisho_10
Reviews.Content: Great location near Union Square. Good hotel, no air conditioning. No fridge. No microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great, room was small but clean, location convenient”
Reviews.Author: noe96744
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located to shopping, buses, food, & cable car. The rooms were quite compact, not too much leg space once you get your luggage in the room - but we didn't spend too much time in the room. The clawed foot tub was a little wobbly but kind of quaint. The staff were very nice and knowledgeable with directions.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE - don't stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: athoms
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at the Baldwin. We understand it's not the Bellagio but the customer service was disgraceful. Our room flooded with the insides of a faulty toilet after spending the night being woken up by a noisy piping system. We were moved to a smaller room where approximately 50% of the TV Channels didn't have reception. On departure we spoke to management who at first believed moving us to the cheaper room was sufficient compensation. After a 30 minute debate we were given a 20% discount. Given our experience we hardly thought that was good enough. The location is good but for the same price there are plenty of other places to stay in the same area. It was our first trip to San Francisco, pretty sad way to remember such a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: RadoMazz
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I find expensive hotels to be a fast waste of money. But I'm not going to stay in a dump either..... Went to a convention at the Moscone Center. Stayed here. This hotel is small, clean and friendly. And an easy, pleasant, 10 minute walk to the convention center. The elevator and hall are maybe a little scuffed but not bad. My room was clean and comfortable. The only issue for me personally was the 3:00 check in. Consider this when making your travel plans... Saved between $400 - $500 by staying here 3 nights instead of at the convention hotels near the Moscone..... Excellent hotel for the budget conventioneer or leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convient and good value”
Reviews.Author: PJKNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: Eight of us had 4 rooms for 5 nights. All very clean and comfortable, rooms small but adequate. Very handy location in the city could not be better located. I would recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean, friendly and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: DesertDweller10
Reviews.Content: It was everything we were looking for. A great location which was in a nice safe area. The room was clean and looked recently renovated. We had a room on the 8th floor towards the back so it was quiet. The staff were very helpful and it seemed to be a very popular hotel. Only thing it did not have that would have been nice is coffee making facilties in the room. There was always some on the go in the lobby though. There was a very convenient 7/11 around the corner and heaps of places to eat close by. Used the BART from the airport ($8.10 o.w) and walked up a few blocks from Powell St station. Loved the towel animals each day, very cute touch.

Reviews.Title: “better than i expected”
Reviews.Author: bugoff1229
Reviews.Content: after reading some reviews I was pleasantly surprised by my room. I am a middle aged girl solo traveler. my room was just around corner from elevator and on upper floor so my room was quiet, slept with windows open, room clean nice bedding and cute animal towels on bed. If you are a business hotel type though, this may not be for you but it was just fine for me. Small, clean, cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GlenB062
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small in this older style hotel. The location was excellent only 5 minutes walk from Montgomery St BART. There would be better hotels in close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been perfect with better customer service.”
Reviews.Author: stephb79
Reviews.Content: My husband and took our one vacation of the year to San Francisco and did a lot of research on where to stay. We picked the Baldwin Hotel for its location, good price and positive reviews. The hotel was perfect for us - great location, good sized room with a big closet, surprisingly quiet. It has less of a hotel feeling and more of feeling like a house (the doors have actual keys rather than cards!) and I really don't have any complaints at all about the hotel itself. But, we did have a disappointing experience with customer service that tainted our stay. We were in Vancouver before heading to SF, and the night before our flight my husband got a terrible case of food poisoning from our dinner. He was so sick there was no way we could travel the next day and we had to change our flight to the following day. So, instead of spending the 4 nights we at the Baldwin we had planned, we missed the first night and were there for 3 nights. I called them right away to let them know we would be a day late. It is their policy to charge you for the night unless you have a doctor's note as proof of illness -- which we of course didn't, since we were in Canada and my husband didn't need a doctor, he just needed to get through it and rest for a day. We explained the situation to them multiple times and they just wouldn't budge. Now of course I understand this is their policy, but it's always disappointing when a place of business won't be flexible in extreme circumstances -- it wasn't like we never showed up for our reservation, we got there as soon as we could and still stayed for 3 nights. And the night that we missed was a Monday night -- surely not a busy night where they would have lost money by not renting the room to someone else. It was just frustrating - it was hard to lose a day of our vacation and lose the extra money from having to pay for double hotel rooms that night on top of it. I find that most places of business in that kind of situation will be more understanding. After talking to several people, they finally offered us a complimentary night's stay through the end of this year, but wouldn't let us apply it to the night we missed - and we obviously aren't going back to SF this year, so it wasn't really worth anything. Oh well - it really is a good hotel for price and location and I liked the room - just not so much for above and beyond customer service. They were very penny pinching about the whole thing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean, friendly,safe, affordable”
Reviews.Author: MendozaEcoVerde
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin was a pleasant surprise: Not a luxury hotel, but it has all the characteristics I look for in a hotel: Safe and central location, very clean rooms, professional and friendly staff and affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good localization.”
Reviews.Author: JuCarreiro
Reviews.Content: Baldwin has a very good location. Near Union Square, easy to take the cable car and others public transport. The problens were: very small room, very noise, no air conditioner and only full size bed, that are small for a couple. The parking lot cost $28.50 per day and is far from the hotel. IThe internet access is fast but cost $8.95 per 24 hours. If you are not so exigent, it's a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, gret location, inflexible service.”
Reviews.Author: Luke333
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Baldwin was very comfortable (if loud at night, even on the 8th floor) and the location, near Union Square, Market Ave transit, and Chinatown is hard to beat. Hotel staff wasn't able to give us a late checkout (we only wanted to stay until 12:30 or 1 pm), and they charge $9 per day for wireless access.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to San Francisco be sure to stay at the Baldwin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kramcat
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay here. The rooms were clean we were two blocks away from Union Square and next to Chinatown. The staff in this hotel were very helpful and made us very welcome. Good for holiday and business. Do not get the shuttle bus to airport (10 dollars) better off in Taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel and good value for money. Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: The_Fosters_1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location, a nice safe area of San Francisco near the shops and pretty close to the chinese quarter. Although it is a fairly small hotel, the rooms are well appointed, very comfortable and lovely & clean. Don't be put off by the slightly odd smell in the reception area (just a bit old smelling), and the unfriendly manner of some (not all) of the staff, these two minor things aside we all thought it was a great hotel and was perfect for what we needed for our short stay in San Francisco. Would definitely consider stopping there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Nick1907
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baldwin for 4 nights in September, having stayed at the hotel 3 years ago. As a result we knew what to expect, the hotel is in a great location, the rooms are clean and the staff are helpful and friendly. The first time we stayed we had a room at the front of the hotel which was a bit noisy (due to traffic etc outside), this time we had a room at the rear which was much quieter, although had no view. We would definitely stay again as the location is great and the hotel offers excellant value for money

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel to match the fantastic city!!”
Reviews.Author: siobhanbbl
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was fantastic. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. The room was comfy with all the basic comforts you would need. After a long day of sight seeing and walking the streets of San Fran, it was lovely to come back and soak in the tub. The price was incrediably nice considering the proximity to everything in Union Square and within blocks of every transport to get you where ever you need to go. Do have a little patience for the elevator, its a little older and it moves rather slow.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: Vumba
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin is my home away from home when I am in San Francisco. I have stayed here many times and will do so in the future. Great value for the price. Convenient and comfortable. Everything I need is within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Older but quite satisfactory for the money”
Reviews.Author: sam154980
Reviews.Content: Very courteous and helpful staff. Clean room. Great location for access to the transit and shopping with minimal street noise. Just make sure you don't get a room beside the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: leosip65
Reviews.Content: No other place where to stay in San Francisco for that price. The only problem was the wi=fi system didn't work with m Ipad but for that Starbucks is only 50 meters

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, loud elevators”
Reviews.Author: Suzuki267
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to San Francisco, and this location was perfect. Parking around the corner was reasonable for a city like this, but since we were exploring anyway, I extracted the car early in the morning and parked all day for free by the marina, so only paid overnight parking cost. Rooms were larger and cleaner than you'd get for this price in New York, and far nicer albeit old - hey, it's an old building, and they haven't tried to "boutique hotel" it, and I like that historic flavour. Clawfoot tubs are nice, but the enclosed curtain form of showering is not my favourite - but it's not a big negative, it's only a shower. Not much room to put things in the bathroom - shelf space is next to nil. They should get modern electronic key entry systems too; anyone could copy a key to the room and the hotel. Location in a swank area right beside Chinatown entrance was perfect. Street noise was amply controlled with closed window, but on a hot night that might get stifling. Much worse was the noise of the antiquated elevators, they woke me up a lot all night. It was a lot better with earplugs, but somehow it's louder in the room (which was right beside the elevators, to be fair) than in the elevator itself. Not sure anything could be done about it really; rip out a wall and insulate perhaps. Free internet access in lobby, along with coffee/tea. Very helpful staff made good restaurant recommendations (especially what to avoid as tourist traps). This is not a luxury hotel, it is basic; but it is an incredibly good value for this kind of room and location in a city like SF. I would go back even with the elevator noise, just I'd put in the earplugs first thing every night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: MSE1970
Reviews.Content: The location is the best point about this hotel, in the heart of downtown, a (small childs) stones throw from China town, about 15 minutes walk from the ferry terminal and well away from the tourist slum that is Fisherman's Wharf. Facilities are limited but the location means there are loads of eating & drinking options nearby, and a laundrette around the corner. I enjoyed my stay which was helped by the fact that SF is one of my favourite cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: waiwingtaialbert
Reviews.Content: Pros - Well located. Very easy to walk to all parts of town. Near to Chinatown as well. The people running this outfit are friendly, helpful and efficient. Rooms were clean. Good value for money. Cons - Small rooms (queen size beds only). For 2 persons with 3 or 4 suitcases (if shopping is the main aim of the trip), there is hardly space to walk. Internet costs 9 bucks a day. Loud street noise at night. They still use old fashioned keys, and it is sometimes difficult to open the doors. No valet parking. You have to park the car in a nearby garage (28 bucks a day), and walk back and forth yourself to collect the car.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: travellingbrit99
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 night stay here. It's a really nice hotel, great location for shopping and good for a bit of sightseeing too. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Rooms were fairly small but spotlessly clean. The only bad thing about this hotel was the bedroom doors! It took us a while to get in ours at first as it was stiff and awkward, but ok after a bit, but when our new neighbours turned up at midnight and spent half an hour trying to open and then close there door it was not good! Definately recommend the hotel, just take some ear plugs in case your doors aren't good!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: FaustoViterbo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, nice people and location. I recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convinient and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: caloymd
Reviews.Content: Apart from enjoying Chinatown which is just few meters away from the Pagoda (gate), every deparment stores and fine dinnings are within walking distance. Rates are very reasonable for a place close to everything I wanted to be. Front dest are very helpfull and cordial. There are no frills but rooms are comfortable and a perfect place to relax your muscles after a day of walking. My best experience so far is when Ms. Viet Voung helped me to get 2 rooms on busy season and was able to give me a good discount as frequent guest.

Reviews.Title: “Will definintely return here!”
Reviews.Author: koens640
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about the Baldwin. I have never written an online review before but really wanted others to know about this place. Budget and safety were top concerns for me when booking this trip -- I am a female graduate student, as is the friend I traveled with. I did thorough research on hotels in San Francisco and this was BY FAR the best price I came across, especially for this location (I honestly don't understand how they manage to keep their costs so low in such an expensive city; when we were there I passed by a hotel that I had previously seen online but decided not to go with because it was three times the price, it was located just down the block from the Baldwin but looked very much run down, while the Baldwin was very well maintained). We were a short walk from museums, shopping, restaurants and bars and felt comfortable taking the bus back from Haight later at night after going out over there (plenty of public transportation stops are on Market Street, just a few blocks away). The room was no frills but rather spacious, and VERY clean and quiet. The staff was WONDERFUL, always providing directions and recommendations on places to eat. They also had a $15 shuttle to the airport, which was definitely much cheaper than a cab. The only downside was that there wasn't a fridge in the room, and they didn't provide free internet, though there is a Starbucks just up the block with WiFi service. If you're looking for a super luxury hotel, this isn't the place for you. But if you're looking for a nice, spotless room at an incredibly reasonable rate in the heart of the city, you should definitely book this. This hotel is truly a steal, and I will definitely recommend it to friends and return there for my next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Solid all-around, great location”
Reviews.Author: dtandrews
Reviews.Content: Great price, room was clean, staff was very attentive, had no issues. Room wasn't big or lavish, but it had everything you'd need. Prime location, 30 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, wish internet access had been free...”
Reviews.Author: DMelissa
Reviews.Content: Loved the Baldwin, it was a quaint old hotel right outside of Chinatown. I have no complaints, the front desk staff was VERY helpful. I do wish though that the internet access was free, $8.95 to get access was a surprise. I'd stay there again though, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A good option for hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: cpbdn
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just outside of China Town and it's really easy to move from there to almost everywhere. The rooms are clean and big enough, except the ones adapted for wheelchairs. I got one of these and because the bathroom has to be adapted and need more space, the space dedicated to the bedroom results tiny for two people, even if they sell it as double bedroom. Also, because is adapted it does not have a bath or shower plate, but the water goes directly to the floor. I would have really appreciated the hotel asking me before giving me an adapted room. My friends got a normal room which was roomy and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for the money paid”
Reviews.Author: anttraveller85
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is excellent. For the money this is the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel, well located and clean - staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: Drlarinlou
Reviews.Content: Great value , not fancy but very functional with a very helpful staff Comfortable bed , flat screen tv

Reviews.Title: “Value and Location: Yes. Sleep Quality? Umm . . . No.”
Reviews.Author: SnailspaceToronto
Reviews.Content: I guess I knew to some extent what I was getting in to with a reservation at the Baldwin - other Tripadvisor posters alluded to it - stayed here a total of 7 nights in July on business and leisure in San Francisco, after having arranged 75.00 CDN on Priceline. The criteria I apply to a good hotel, regardless it be a 1 star or 4 star, is location, value, cleanliness, staff, and sleep. On 4 of the 5 points, the Baldwin does score well. The location is prime, right off Union Square, within walking distance to most everything. Gold star for that. Value - well, for 75.00/night, I cannot complain on the financial front. The Hotel is very clean, the cleaning service impeccable and efficient, the desk staff friendly and outgoing. No faults there. It comes down to this: For a hotel, a business in the business of providing you a place to lay your head, The Baldwin is noisy noisy noisy. And that's where I can only afford a poor rating to sleep quality. While the hotel has been recently renovated, had they gone the extra mile and replaced the dual key lock system and the thin doors, this might be a different review. People arriving late at night next to us on 3 different nights jangled keys, fumbled, cursed, banged around, all in an attempt to get into the rooms adjacent to us. This was at 11:30, 1:30, and 2:45 am respectively (or rather, lack-of-respect-ively) As well, older wooden doors bang and creak. The Baldwin's room doors hit those jarring notes in spades. Key card locks would have been a better renovation solution, coupled with quiet-close doors. It always astonishes me that more hotels don't do this. Rooms to the front suffer from the late night noise of Grant Avenue traffic and crowds, rooms in the middle hear every creak and groan of the over-worked elevator, and rooms next to the alley (where we were, have the constant drone and vibration of the enormous exhaust fan from the car park in behind. Double-glazed glass only barely muffles these noises. It does absolutely nothing at all to block the noise of a dozen dumpsters being uploaded every night in the alley by San Francisco's sanitation services - the backup beeping, the shouts, the clang as dumpster after dumpster is tossed around. All at ungodly hours between 1:30 and 4 am. Every . . single . . .day. Earplugs and an extra pillow over the head, you'll still be woken bolt upright when those trucks come. It may be slightly better on the 9th or 10th floors, but we were on the 8th, and you still picked up every noise down below. Other than the noise, the Baldwin is a good hotel. If you are a heavy sleeper, then you'll not do better than this hotel for value and location. If you're a lighter sleeper, well, you've been advised.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lee_g15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Baldwin Hotel for 2 nights. Good - great location (so close to chinatown & union square), comfortable bed, decent size rooms (we were there only to sleep), renovated bathroom, decent price Bad - very noisy from the garbage truck pick up from outside (for the 2 nights we were there), the heater was making weird noises - it was an old gas oil heater, the room is quite old except for the renovated toilet Tip: * Just in case you check in late, the front door shuts at 9pm but there is someone there

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: michitrav
Reviews.Content: The Civic Center neighborhood is a great location for tourists. Lots of other hotels around, & located right outside the ChinaTown gate. Lots of good stores & restaurants, safe comfortable wandering around; good access to buses. Baldwin has limited service; only one desk person in lobby. You will park your own car, hump your own bags. Small room (expected in older city hotel), very clean. We were four adults (our two adult kids with us). Only one chair in room, so you will read in bed if there is more in your party and it's not easy to read in bed with only one pillow!! Load us up with pillows & good quality bedding!!! Time for an upgrade there. We do prefer smaller more personal hotels, which this is, & would not want to stay in a big-box Hilton or others similar, although I know they are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “safe and perfect location to visit san francisco attractions”
Reviews.Author: sumandatta
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights and it was a great experience. Rooms were good and service was nice. Best thing was the location. Very near Chinatown and Union Square and easily accessible through bus service to fisherman's wharf and golden gate etc. (Bus route 30). Ideal for tourists who want a budget stay in a safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Baldwin”
Reviews.Author: Canoodle
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Baldwin,the first time being two years ago.In the interim reno's have been done and was pleasantly surprised to find flat screen TV's ,part of the new additions. It's probably not often that one cant come up with any major criticisms of a budget hotel. If one takes the Baldwin at face value-ie. a budget option it really is a stretch to come up with any criticism's. The hotel is well located-as all reviewers point out just down teh road from the main entrance to China Town.Walk staright down Grant St and North Beach is an easy 25 min stroll with Fisherman;s Wharf being an additional 10 minutes or so. If not inclined to walk buses in Stockton St (one block over) run through North Beach ( a must visit) to the Wharf. Back to the Baldwin- rooms are smallish,as is the norm in SF,no aircon,but ceiling fan which worked well-windows open fully which is a real plus.Had room facing Grant St which is noisy with windows open,but once closed,the noise level abates considerably. A safe for valuables is provided and the bathrooom is perfectly functional and spotless. Hot water was always available.The housekeeping staff were excellent and make little arrangements with the towels,which are then left on the bed- a really nice touch. To sum up the Baldwin is an excellent budgey choice-for $75 a night its got to be very hard value to beat. I cant see myself staying anywhere else next time I get to visit,which hopefully wont be in the too distant future- heck next time round, might even bring the wife !!

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: juliejulie33
Reviews.Content: great position, very friendly and helpful staff, reasonable price (w/o free internet nor breakfast), great for city tour

Reviews.Title: “poor service, not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Raphel97
Reviews.Content: no free internet, no refrigrator in room. poor service, not worth the money. Although the loacation is good. But you have to spend more on other stuff, such as internet and breakfast. I would rather choose some other hotels with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinSueWashingto
Reviews.Content: We found the Baldwin to be a lovely hotel in a great location. Safe area just outside the gate to Chinatown and a short walk to Union Square. We stayed here for our 10-year-anniversary and were more than pleased. Front desk is courteous and welcoming. Security of front door and desk in evening hours to be appreciated. Rooms are clean and well-kept, though sparsley decorated which didn't matter to us, and the renovated bathrooms are spacious and charming. The hotel does not have a restuarant or lounge, but we did not find this to be a problem. Within very short walking distance is Starbucks, located less than a minute away a, fancy cafe just across and a little up the street, and a wine bar directely across. The Warf and Pier 39 are a bit away, but easy to get to by cable car which is inexpensive and easy to use. The ferry bulding is an easy 15/20 minute walk. I would stay at the Baldwin again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, great value - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: thea_rikke
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at Baldwin hotel in June 2010. The first impression wasn't that good due to the size of our room & bed, apparently the room also missed air conditioner, but actually we never needed one while staying there. The more we stayed, the more we liked the place. The temperature in the room was comfortable (at least they had a big fan on the ceiling), there were 3 windows (one in the bathroom, which we especially liked). The bed appeared to be quite comfortable for two. The room had a closet and a lock box, and we found enough space for our luggage. The staff was very friendly and helpful, there was no problem to store the luggage after we checked out. Towels and linen were changed every day even though we didn't ask for it. Every night we kept on finding a funny animal made out of small towels on the bed, so we were happy to leave some tips to the maid. It seemed that the staff made its best to make our stay enjoyable. The Grant Ave was mostly quiet, though it's only 3 min walk from Union Square, and the Chinatown gate is just next door, so we couldn't imagine any better location. The hotel missed a lot of amenities, such as free wifi & parking (public parking nearby costed about $26-30 per night), any food service etc. But there were anough of nice cafes & eateries nearby, and for the price we paid we had probably the best place to stay in this area. I would definitely recommend Baldwin Hotel to my friends and to those who's looking for a nice center-located place for a valuable price.

Reviews.Title: “Just right! Best location, best price.”
Reviews.Author: grace06529
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room and tastefuly furnished in the 5th floor. The problem with the elevator is not so bad. It just stops in the 4th floor whether you like it or not. Just be patient. After 30 seconds it will continue in its trip up or down.

Reviews.Title: “Best money can get!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kenny13
Reviews.Content: Staying in Baldwin right now, till 22 Jun. It's a nice hotel for $80ies/ night on weekdays. The room is just renovated, clean, comfy. Bathroom is super clean too. Though I was hesitate to book at first since the rate is so low. But it's actually very nice hotel, covers more than basic needs of sleep n shower. Great location!!! Close to public transport too. There's also a Wallgreen 24/ 7 store two blocks away on Powell St. This hotel is a perfect choice for fellow TAs who are looking for affordable and above average hotel in SF.

Reviews.Title: “great location! nice place!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaGlenview
Reviews.Content: great great location. very nice place to stay in downtown. very close to "china town" about 10 seconds of walking :)

Reviews.Title: “The Baldwin Hotel exceeded what few expectations we had.”
Reviews.Author: jnj102305
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved a 2 night stay at the Baldwin Hotel in June. It was our first time staying in the City and had no idea what to expect. We had done quite a bit of research online so we knew that affordable hotels in San Francisco are much different than hotels we stay at in other areas. So we went with very few expectations, knowing we would probably have a tiny room, in a run-down hotel, with zero amenities. We showed up to the Baldwin 2 hours before check-in time. We were greeted by a very friendly staff who offered for us to leave our luggage behind the counter until our room was ready for us. We had reserved our room under the Holiday Shopping Package ($220 for 2 nights)which included free parking in their parking garage around the corner, so he gave us our parking pass and mapped out the directions to the parking garage. He even came out to the car to unload our bags for us. We then drove around the corner to the parking garage, gave the attendant the pass and our keys, and took off walking while they parked our car for us. After exploring Chinatown, (the hotel is less than a block away from the Chinatown Gate) we returned to the hotel about 20 minutes before check-in time, in which our room was ready. We headed up the small elevator to our room on the third floor. Our first impression upon reaching the third floor was the strange smell in the hallway and the door to our room which angled rather close to the door next to ours. To our surprise, the inside of the room was rather nice. Much more than we were expecting. The furniture is modern and new as advertised. The decor is typical hotel decor but the flat screen tv on the dresser across from the bed distracted us from the ugly comforter and curtains. The bathroom was clean with newer features. The shower was an old clawfoot tub with a wrap-around curtain. The best part for me was the ceiling fan above the bed. The best part for my husband was the tv of course. The large window in our room faced the alleyway and the building next to the hotel so the view wasn't great, but it probably helped a little with the noise. The window was new and opened easily and wide. There was no screen on the window but bugs weren't an issue. Just having the nice breeze circulating in the room made what could have been a semi-stuffy hotel room, a cool place to relax. The bed was pretty good for a hotel bed. The sheets and comforter were soft, not starchy. The mattress was solid, but not hard. It had some bit of soft padding on top that helped. Everytime we entered or exited the building, the person at the front desk would say hello, and have a good day/night. They were always very friendly and spoke english rather well. The front door of the hotel locks at 9pm every night for security purposes, so upon checking-in the give you a key to the front door in case you return after 9. We returned around 10 every night, in which the deskperson would see us and open the door automatically. We felt special being let in instead of having to fiddle with a lock in the dark. The only legitimate complaints I have about staying at the Baldwin which really aren't fair because it was out of their control, are the noise and the slow/malfunctioning elevator. The noise in San Francisco is unavoidable so sleeping with your window open is not an option in most locations but even with our window closed, you could hear lots of banging and horns honking. The problem with the elevator wasn't a big deal as there was a flight of stairs right next to them, in case we didn't feel like waiting. Apparently, the elevator was stopping for 30 seconds on the 4th floor everytime it would go up or down so it was causing quite a delay.
