We never saw anyone else get on or off the elevator so traffic wasn't an issue. Being on the third floor, we took the stairs a couple times to avoid waiting. The hotel staff did post a note of apology inside and outside the elevator explaining the problem. Check-out at 11pm was painless and took all of 20 seconds. We walked our bags down to the parking garage, although if you prefer you could go get your car first and come back for your luggage. We handed the parking attendant our stub, he returned with our car, and we were on our way home. Just like that! We were impressed at how smooth everything went. No problems whatsover. Everyone was friendly, courteous, and did their job well. For all you coffee lovers, the hotel might have served coffee in the morning( I never checked), but there is also a Starbucks 3 doors down from the hotel. There are plenty of different eating establishments within a block or two of the hotel, as well as bus and cable car stops nearby. Traveling from our hotel to the various attractions around the city was easy with the help of a map and a little pre-trip research. I would recommend this hotel to a friend, as it exceeded what few expectations we had. We were very pleased with our choice of hotel within our price range. It met our needs for location and affordable, and ended up being a really nice place to stay. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't beat the price for the room or location”
Reviews.Author: lingit
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from the Montgomery train station and within walking distance of everything,including Giants stadium. Front desk was nice and gave pointers on everything we asked. The most comfortable bed I've slept on in a while and that surprised my roomate and I. Breakfast,shopping,bars,Chinatown, all within walking. I booked a couple months in advance so the price was great. I checked rates closer to the check-in date(memorial day wknd) and would have paid more if I didn't book so far out. Had a room overlooking the alley so noise was no problem. Small room but plenty for 2 people. Bathroom updated and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Baldwin Hotel - Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal with the Baldwin Hotel on Priceline. It was in such a perfect location for tourists. A few feet (literally) from the Chinatown Gate, a few blocks from all transportation, right in the midst of Union Square shopping, one block from the Grand Hyatt where we had drinks on the 36th floor and enjoyed the awesome view of the city, two blocks from Sears Fine Foods for breakfast, etc, etc. Could not have been in a better location for tourism. We walked to the Ferry Building one morning and walked back from Fishermans Wharf one afternoon (about 30 minute walk). The staff was so pleasant and helpful with recommendations and they even watched our bags while we did last minute touring. The room was basic, somewhat small but comfortable and clean. View was of the street below where all the shopping was. Very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mobeth10
Reviews.Content: The staff of the hotel is very friendly. The location is very good, walking distance to cafes, commercial center, public transportation and tour bus. The room was spacious enough and quiet, even though it was in a busy street. The region is ok to walk at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price ;-)”
Reviews.Author: JorgeUrena
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean, and well situated for what I was doing. Near many small restaurant, near shopping, and sight seeing. The only thing I didn't like was the smell of the hallway near my room on the 5th floor. It smelled like Big Man Sweat. Ugh ! The midnight trash truck pick up was loud, but I assume all hotels in the area have this annoyance. Other than that I would stay again if needed. Thank you Baldwin Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good value, don't expect everything, but you wont pay for too much.”
Reviews.Author: ihearttraveldeals
Reviews.Content: GREAT location for the price. Close to shopping and fun night life. Not a quiet or luxurious hotel, but it has almost anything you would need. I have stayed here twice and the staff has been very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - good value with adequate comfort - helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Alamo77
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel within sight of the Chinatown Gate & is in a very good location for walking and virtually all public transport routes including SFO main airport. An old established hotel with heating system that is a little antiquated - can't turn off - but all in all this hotel was very good value - economy prevails when folk wish to tour & enjoy without watching the dollars & dimes too much. Helpful staff able to provide good advice on transport & an excellent Chinese restaurant in Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: sillythetourist
Reviews.Content: I loved San Fran, and this hotel was a pretty great find, comfortable rooms, and amazing location... There were minor things that were annoying e.g. the shower rod holding together the shower was broken, and the cleaning lady walking in as i was asleep at 9 am, these things were only a small annoyance, but i still would recommend this hotel, really friendly staff, and they were very accommodating to hold our luggage when we had a late flight, a great price too, the only thing that was a bit of a pain was the wi-fi was not free, and every hotel i have stayed in in the usa has had internet included free, but still would highly recommend hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRRKent
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Rooms were clean, inexpensive and as quiet as a downtown hotel can be.  Staff helpful and friendly. Good central location with lots of restaurants, cafes, and bars within walking distance. We recommend Cafe de la Presse just across the street for breakfast. Also, just a 5 minute walk to Market St for the BART and Muni stations, cable car terminal and F line stops. Bad points, only one lift and the free coffee in the lobby is pretty horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tmy62070
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin was a quaint little hotel that provides great value. They have updated the rooms but left some of its historic character. The staff and service were always effienent and friendly. It's location is right outside the gate to China Town and is close to many locations within the financial district. There are plenty of shopping and dining opportunities within a few blocks of the front door. When visiting SF on business or leisure I will be sure to look up The Baldwin.

Reviews.Title: “Really a good value”
Reviews.Author: Kansastraveller1
Reviews.Content: This is a fine place to stay if you are looking for a low price place without a lot of bells and whistles. I liked it quite a bit. The front desk help was excellent. The rooms were small, about normal size. My room was very dated--and quaint--but it was absolutely spotless and clean. The hall smelled a little musty, but the room was fine. The location is right in the middle of the action in near Union Square and about a block from the Chinatown gate. All in all, i don't think you'll find a better value in the low end market. This is not a fancy place.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: soday1612
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable. It doesn't have a lot of amenities but it was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. It's conveniently located too tourist attractions, dinning and shopping. The price was reasonable and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kalenuke
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel right at the center of SF. Only minus could be the lack of airconditioning on the hot summer monts (propeller on the ceiling though...)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable charming room, great location, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: LinTurtle
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Baldwin Hotel in San Francisco for three nights this past week, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I loved the charming corner room. It was very clean, comfortable and roomy, and it was fun to look at the views of the streets from the windows. The location was perfect for my visit as I was able to walk different directions each morning and find something new to experience in San Francisco. It is just a few steps from the beginning of Chinatown, and I felt very safe walking in the blocks close to the hotel. The staff was very pleasant, courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: solotravel2010
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed here. I have found the room to be clean, staff is friendly and location is great . It is close to public transportation and Union Square. I would not hesitant to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “no frills accommodation in central location”
Reviews.Author: Sue186346
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located, which has some pluses but more minuses for me - it was noisy at night, with garbage van collections in the middle of the night as well as the usual traffic noise. The room was adequate but definitely no frills - but the bed was comfortable. Unfortunately someone in the neighbouring room left at 4 am every day I was there (5 days) and because of the noise of leaving - two keys are required to open and unlock the room doors, I was woken up every time. There are very limited facilities in this hotel, I wanted a spoon to eat a yogurt but they were unable to provide one. There is basically just coffee and tea downstairs in the lobby. There is a good cafe just across the road which is open early for breakfast. The staff were quite helpful especially when I was left stranded after the volcano issue prevented me leaving as planned, but they are basically there to deal with reservations and enquiries and seem to have little to do with the running of the place. The hair dryer in the room did not work, and most channels on the tv had so much interference that it was impossible to view them. Definitely a budget level hotel -

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location and so helpful in a crisis!”
Reviews.Author: eNickEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: A big big thank you to everyone at the Baldwin who went to such lengths to help me out when I was stranded in San Francisco due to the volcanic eruption. My planned 1 week stay turned into 2 weeks and the hotel was amazingly helpful. They extended my stay at short notice on discount rates (when I'd have paid a lot more) but said that if I got a flight I could cancel the remaining nights without penalty. They were very helpful with printing boarding cards etc. for me. And I had terrific service from everyone from the manager (who personally visited me when my room lock jammed to make sure I was happy with the replacement and wasn't too inconvenienced by now having two different room keys) right down to the room maids. This is a budget hotel so you won't get air con or in room kettle but it is a great little place in a great location. It's a safe area to walk, day or night, and right near some of the main attractions and close to the BART - which is the main mode of transport (like London's tube) from SFO airport to town. If you want a place to stay that is well priced, with genuinely helpful staff, in a great location but aren't fussed for frills like mini-bar or air con then this is the place for you. I will definitely be staying there on my next business trip to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel if you suffer from hearing loss”
Reviews.Author: OshawatlcRN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location and staff are friendly ; HOWEVER, there is one caveat and that is if you are booked in a room facing Grant Street the noise at night is unending due to the large alley directly across the street with at least 12 industrial garbage bins that are emptied at all hours of the night. Also the rooms ending in 01 are abutting the old elevator and it clunks and bangs all night.It was a great stay in San Francisco if you don't mind the lack of sleep at night!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: TheSwissFamilyF
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an 8 day stay at the Baldwin. Was supposed to be only 3 days but we got caught up in the flight cancellations back to Europe due to the volcano and had to book extra 5 nights. The staff were extremely helpful and sympathetic about our situation. The hotel itself is small and fairly old fashioned but it's location was excellent and the rooms comfortable and quiet (apart from the dumpster trucks which seem to operate all night long). We would certainly stay here again if we return to S.F

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Meli-Eze
Reviews.Content: booked the hotel at really good, price, thought the place wouldnt be as nice as it seems in the pictures but it excedeed my expectations, super clean & big room & bathroom. Amazing location, close to all shopping venues and near all transportation (BART, cable car & Muni Buses). I fully recomend the hotel; the only thing, try to ask for a room far from the elevator because it´s noisy, and a floor high up, because the view is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location wit super clean room ;-)”
Reviews.Author: Airline_officer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nites. It's a safe and warm place for an Asian girl travelin alone like me. Felt like stayin at home. Room was very clean wit comfy bed, flat tv screen and nice view. There was no fridge or room service but u can order from "Order Inn" 11am-1am if u don't wanna walk around late at nite. There were so many restaurants and shops around hotel. Only 20 meters to China Town wit cheap and nice restaurants. U don't have to take taxi, can just walk around town if u don't have legs problem cos of hills in SF, heheheee... Staff were helpful. Elevator here was very old and scary. It was super noisy all day + nite if u got a room on street side but I still recommend this hotel if u r on the budget ;-)

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Pisoa
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and really liked the place : It is perfectly-well located in SF to enjoy the city. The room was on the 9th floor, quiet and bright. Add to that, the cleaning was done every day so our room was spick and span. A hotel I would advise to solo traveller too, as it is affordable and well located to reach by night.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: captainmidwest
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to China Town and a few blocks from the BART.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great service, I would be willing to bet the best value near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: jazimm2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 2 other couples went there for vacation last week. It was a wonderful experience. The staff was exceptionally curteous and the value was amazing! I had never been to San Fran and it was perfectly located near chinatown, which was great, and less than 2 blocks to trolley, cable cars, buses and 3-4 blocks from the F-line train. I will say that I thought the beds could have been a little more comfortable, but I said that about the Hyatt Regency I stayed at the week before in Boston so...whatever! It's an older hotel, but the character. location and service make it a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: WestSideFamily
Reviews.Content: We really appreciated the location of the hotel and the price. It is in the Financial District and close to China Town. The rooms are similar to those we stayed in in Europe - very quaint. And they were very clean. The the tub (with a shower) is an old claw foot tub -and may be difficult for people to climb into if they have leg problems. The staff were very friendly and helpful and know their city. Next time we are in San Francisco we will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice hotel, inexpensive near the good part of Union Square.”
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this hotel is inexpensive, but I'm not about to complain. The rooms were very clean, the bathrooms had a very new look to them and the staff was very accomodating. We got (slightly) late check-out but they held our luggage for us all day while we walked around town. The only negatives...a very nice TV that has interference or a weak signal. And the wifi was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: TravelerJDFontana_CA
Reviews.Content: No frills, but you can't beat the rate and location. Nearby hotels charge at least two times as much for the nightly rates. The Baldwin is conveniently located near China Town, Union Square, Financial District, and BART all of which are within reasonable walking distances. Outside noise could be a factor , but could be lessen with the windows closed.

Reviews.Title: “The Baldwin offers excellent value in a fine location.”
Reviews.Author: Viagger
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin is a great hotel for anyone who cares little about elegance, but values being in a clean, well-run hotel in an excellent location with helpful staff and very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: ml77
Reviews.Content: We liked: - excellent location close to Union Square and Chinatown, a few minutes from Montgomery BART station - very good value We would have liked: - free wifi

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: nenaqu
Reviews.Content: this place has everything a traveler to san francisco would require. incredible location. it was easy to travel to and from the hotel. the room was clean and spacious. the front desk was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “All you could ask for- marvellous staff, lovely rooms, and central to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Cazpar26
Reviews.Content: Staff so helpful and welcoming- I phoned and the staff member helped me with shuttle and then welcomed me so nicely at the hotel. It was late and I was exhausted but the staff member was patient, professional and so kind. Room lovely, very comfy. Next morning, staff helped me with organising return shuttle and happily looked after my bags so I could explore one last time! A marvellous trip and a marvellous hotel- highly recommend! Caz

Reviews.Title: “convenient location but stinky”
Reviews.Author: umnike
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights and felt the Baldwin was very conveniently located, had great customer service, and a clean bathroom. However, the hallways and room smelled like thirty year old stale carpet. Also, having a room that faced the alleyway, we were awakened each night at 2am for trash collection. Very noisy!

Reviews.Title: “perfect middle range hotel”
Reviews.Author: tboandspit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only, however there are no complaints about this hotel. The rooms were small yes however, not small enough that you cannot move. I traveled with my father, and we still had enough room to keep out of each others space. Bathroom was sufficient, and clean. Room was clean overall, and so was the hotel. Windows open for a bit of a breeze however street noise filters in, this was not a problem for us though, as we are both deep sleepers. So so close to everything you need, walking distance to union square, and BART. So convenient, surrounded by Cafe's and right on the doorstep of china town. I could highly recommenced this hotel to anyone who wants a middle of the range hotel in San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “A great value but with some small tweaks could be a tremendous value.”
Reviews.Author: britwon
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the Baldwin. Let me first compliment that very courteous staff. They were all very nice and easy to ask questions of and so much more. Top notch bunch. The location is excellent for the shopping as well as the Moscone or business centers. The rooms were spacious and for the most part clean. The bed was comfortable. I had a couple of problems. One, I had a claw foot tub and the shower curtain had hair all over it (it was not my hair). There is a safe but no refrigerator, which would have been good. There was a lot of noise coming from the alley in the morning when garbage or linens were picked up. These things would not deter me from coming back again. The staff is worth it, the rooms are plentiful and overall value is high.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: mrprpf
Reviews.Content: Although it is not a modern hotel, everything is in very good condition, clean and cozy. The location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice people, good location”
Reviews.Author: amarionLyon
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of positive comments about Baldwin hotel and I was not disappointed. It is well located, close to union square, people from reception were nice and the room was large and clean. The only small negative point is that Baldwin do not propose real breakfast nor free wifi. I paid 75$ with taxes for a king size bed. The price is interesting compared to the service. I recommend it without reserve.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms next to elevator are very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: tzx
Reviews.Content: The room next to elevator is very noisy. The evelator make sound like hammer while working. I stayed 3 nights in that room. It's terrrible, I can't sleep. Later I had to ask for change a room. If anyone want to reserve the hotel, DO NOT stay the rooms next to elevator. The location of this hotel is convenient, near to moscone center. The staff at front desk is friendly, very kind. They are willing to help me.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews on Trip Advisor Misleading”
Reviews.Author: 4biz
Reviews.Content: After reading TripAdvisor I was certain I could make this "boutique" hotel work for us. We arrived early and were not given our room until late in the day. Upon arriving in the room there was no heat. This day was rainy and cold like many days in SFO. I asked the front desk where the thermostat was and was advised there was central heat and air (a potential problem on a hot, humid typical summer day in SFO as well). Also advised the central heat did not kick in until the evening. They offered to bring in a portable ceramic heater...which they did and the heater was very noisy. After a shower found there was no blow dryer. Again called to the front desk and was told it was in the dresser drawer. I found the dryer and it was affixed to the inside of the drawer. Nowhere near the bathroom or even a mirror. Short black hair all over the bathroom, none of the usual ammenites of a boutique hotel. Cost $5. to print boarding pass from lobby printer. Hotel held my $100. for incidentals well over a week...still haven't received a credit back to my account for that $100. and am having difficulty getting hotel staff to process the refund. No internet. Must pay for access through hotel site across the street. Cleanliness was sorely lacking. Tub, walls and bathroom floor full of short black hairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great VALUE, great LOCATION, great HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: canuckinoz13
Reviews.Content: We arrived before our check in time and the staff were happy to check us in early. We stayed in a nice sized room with an ensuite and queen sized bed. It was clean, quiet and comfortable. Keep in mind that we arrived on Sunday and checked out the next day, so Sunday night may not be indicative of the noise level on a Friday or Saturday night stay over. The hotel itself looks a little bit 'tired', needs a bit of a reno fresh up, but is still well kept. It is located in a fabulous location, near China Town, all the shops and a short walk to the cable car line. Ticks all the boxes for us - clean, great location, quiet, affordable, and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dynamac
Reviews.Content: the best thing about this hotel is the location. It is super close to union square, bart/metro and major stores such as Macy's. It is next to the gate of chinatown, but the actual chinatown area is still a few blocks north, hence the area is quite peaceful and safe. We took advantage of the stay 3 nights and get a free tour for 2 package (very good deal). We were given a free tour operated by a 3rd party tour company that took us on a 3 hour ride to all the main locations around SF. We stayed in a queen room (1 queen bed only) which was quite small, but the room and bathroom was clean and tidy (nothing special though). It was a surprise to have a LCD TV in the room but it buzzed on certain channels. The heating system (no A/C, just a fan in the ceiling for summers) also made funny sound from time to time during the night which was slightly unpleasant (but this is probably room specific). Overall I recommend this hotel for the budget conscience but still wanting a private and comfortable stay. The location is top notch with an easy bus ride on 8A bus to fisherman's wharf. If you are staying for 3 days or so make sure you get the $18 unlimited metro travel for 3 days. This is available at the visitor centre opposite Macy's. This allows you to travel unlimited on bus/muni/tram (which is otherwise $5), although we found the tram more of a novelty than a viable transport solution. This pass doesn't cover Bart though. Note if you are flying into SFO or oakland (all SF airports are linked by Bart) and staying at baldwin, just take the Bart straight from the airport stop to Montgomery stop. Very easy and fast. Oh and staff are friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic once again!”
Reviews.Author: dcuccia
Reviews.Content: We love this place - fourth New Year's visit in a row and we'll keep coming back. With their online booking system, we got 20% off a 2-nights stay - averaged about $70/night...for a place a block from both Union Square and Chinatown. The place isn't fancy, but it's clean and kept up very well. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are very spacious for the price. Alley-side rooms are nice and quiet. Central heating a little annoying at times. No AC, but there is a room fan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mishie17
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We were able to check in early which was great since our flight had been delayed 3 hours and we were tired. Front desk staff were super nice and very helpful. The hotel is an older hotel but that's what I liked most about it. Room was a good size with comfortable beds and a flat screen TV. It was very clean and in a great location. Chinatown was right at the corner. We walked to the Wharf took us about 20/25 minutes. There is a great Japanese restaurant right next door that gave us a discount for being guests at the Baldwin. There are several cafes and shops in walking distance. Only negative thing I can think of is that a couple of the TV channels had a humming noise on them so we weren't able to watch those channels. Overall, excellent hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Value of the room”
Reviews.Author: Ostracist
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good since the hotel is close to the famous China Town gate and to Union square. Your can get to where you want to go by walking in the shopping area or stores in China Town. However, the traffic is busy and you can easily hear noise from the street even in the mid night. If you can't stand any noise when you sleep, you had better consider other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mangophile
Reviews.Content: A very good experience. I had canceled my initial reservation but my circumstances changed, and when I called the Baldwin back to reinstate my reservation shortly before my stay, they kindly agreed to honor it at the same good rate. Service was excellent--they promptly fixed a running toilet, and helped to resolve internet access problems. (There is a charge for internet access--$10/day or $20 for 3 days.) They also printed out boarding passes without any fuss. The staff was very nice, the room was clean, the mattresses really comfortable and new, and the noise level quite low, especially considering that they are a block away from the Chinatown gate in the midst of a bustling, but safe, part of the city. The hotel is very convenient to several public transportation lines and a short, pleasant walk to lots of attractions. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: skatermom6
Reviews.Content: We visit the area regularly for doctor visits, so we needed a clean, safe hotel for a good price. We were pleased with the Baldwin and their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service and price. Baldwin had it all”
Reviews.Author: KristyGrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Baldwin Hotel for just under a week in December 09. The motel is a little older, but I think this makes it a little more authentic. For the location (half a block from Chinatown and a 5 minute walk from Union Square) the price is unbeatable. Rooms are clean and adequately furnished (a fridge would have been nice) and service was always good; not that we had any outrageous requests or anything. Would stay there again if I ever return to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: airguy
Reviews.Content: I am finally getting caught up after my trip to San Francisco to write a review. The Hotel Baldwin was a very enjoyable stay. I appreciated not being mugged by the homeless every time I entered the hotel, like some of the other places I have stayed in San Francisco. Instead, I felt very safe right in the middle of Union Square and at the gates of Chinatown. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and said hello and good morning as i would venture out. The hotel is not a luxury palace, but is a well run basic hotel. The bed was comfortable, and I had a great view of the city from my room. My only complaint was that sometimes you had to wait awhile for the elevator, but it really wasn't that much of an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Price at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller84010
Reviews.Content: Nice European style hotel. Rooms small, but clean and quiet. Beds very comfortable. Great location within a few minutes walk of Chinatown and Union Square. Front desk very helpful in providing directions for using mass transit. I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very good location”
Reviews.Author: 1Canadian
Reviews.Content: I got a room for one person for just $60 incl tax per night on hotwire. The room was small and bathroom was small. There was nothing luxurious - as expected from a 2-star hotel, but it was clean and well-maintained, and for a New Yorker like me, small space isn't an issue. My room was actually next to the elevator, but I wasn't disturbed by it at all. Internet access was not free but I just paid $9 for 24-hour access, which I think wasn't too bad. Staff at the frontdesk was helpful in getting me a cheap airport shuttle and giving me transportation info. The bottomline is for $60 a night for a hotel in Union Square area close to all major transportation and shopping, it's a real bargain. I will consider staying there the next time I go to SF.

Reviews.Title: “good service and good spot - no frills - but very chill”
Reviews.Author: dbizzle
Reviews.Content: The bottom line is if you're looking for super high-end acommodations, I wouldn't necessarily stay here. But if you want a clean, straight-forward older-school place with great service and conveniently located - this is your spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mollyhowze
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through priceline! The view was great as was the service! The bed was a double bed instead of the usual queen, but was still comfortable! It was blocks from Union Square and all the big stores! The Cheesecake factory atop the Macy's (at least 8 stories) overlooking Union Square was within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dakota11
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin has a great location near Union Square and Chinatown. The rooms are average in size for many in the area but small compared to many newer hotels. We stayed on Thanksgiving and Friday. It was noisy on Thursday night but quiet on Friday night. We stayed on a 2 day shopping special that included free parking and taxes were also included. We used it mainly for sleeping and changing clothes. The room was clean and the staff was helpful!!! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: roeboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Overall I was impressed enough to reccomend this hotel in terms of location and value for money. It is a simple, no frills property located in an older style building. Check in staff were efficent, room was quite small but again, met our needs. The real selling point is location. Turn left at the hotel entrance and It is steps away from Chinatown gate which if you walk through will lead you through this area, down Columbus (Italian Quarter) and eventually down to Fisherman's Wharf. (approx 30min walk) Turn right instead and you are 5 min walk from Cable Car turnaround, 10 min walk to Market street, Union Square and the BART station (cheap and easy way of getting to and from the airport) The hotel is for the budget aware among us. If price of accomodation is not an issue then choose somewhere else but in a similar location. However, if like me you treat your room as little more than a crash pad and somewhere to freshen up between siteseeing and dinner then this hotel will suit your needs well. San Francisco is a very walkable city and the public transport links are pretty decent. In this respect, I would highly reccomend staying in this area as opposed to down at the Wharf where, it is more touristy. It is truely a beautiful city. Some highlights include: cable car to lombard st... hop off... walk down and up to Coit Tower... beautiful views bike the bridge but continue on into Sausalito... explore this lovely bayside community with art gallaries and cafe culture before you and your bike catch the ferry back to the Wharf.... beats cycling back!.. P.S. biking the bridge is a tougher ride than they let on. Go do Napa for the day... Take the nighttime Alcatraz tour instead of the daytime... far superior and atmospheric as dusk and then dark settles while you are out on 'the rock' You will love SF and if you are ok with no frills accomodation then you will love the Baldwin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in a Great Location"”
Reviews.Author: rocklingirl82
Reviews.Content: A great find! Located on Grant Avenue, you can see the gate of Chinatown from your hotel windows. Upscale location, but an excellent price. The holiday special was $68 per night for one queen bed, with free parking included in the price. Can't beat that! Room was neat and very clean. Only problem was with the shower...I couldn't figure out how to turn on the shower head. Other than that, very pleased with the location, service, and the room. Would stay there again and will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean/inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: sfdreamin
Reviews.Content: Definitely not your luxury accommodations but, great value. Staff was very friendly, room clean and in a good location. Only downside was a noisy and slow elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: cocoutah
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the stay, location and accomodations. I would recommend that you get better fitting sheets on the beds. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. You're here to see the city not laze in hotel room.”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler43
Reviews.Content: Great location, at entrance to Chinatown, block away from Prada and Coach. Not far from Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39. You can walk to Market and get a cablecar or muni. We were out and about seeing the city, so small room didn't bother us. Clean with recently renovated bath. Front desk staff always helpful. Noisy at night--our room faced an alley so we heard garbage pickups and street noise. What do you expect, it's the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain - good location - little noisy”
Reviews.Author: edredToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Baldwin first week of Nov '09 for two short visits. Rooms were spacious meticulously clean and good beds (we had two queens). Only problem was the temporary construction going on next door and the mid-night garbage pickups. After a tour of Big Sur we returned for a night prior to our departure back home. Very good for a bargain stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deal”
Reviews.Author: bronco52
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I have no idea why the Baldwin doesn't charge more per night (that's not a suggestion, management!). Given the location, it's absolutely impossible to imagine a better deal. The rooms are simple, but comfortable, clean, well-maintained. The staff is courteous and helpful. I'll be back. The only thing I would have wanted that I didn't get was free internet (the pay option's easy to use, though).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: MM1949
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed at the Baldwin Hotel. The location is excellent, close to Union Square, Chinatown, and the Financial District. Staff is very helpful, the rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: coolwaves
Reviews.Content: My husband goes to a conference once a year in San Francisco and if the conference is near Union Square, we always like to stay at the Baldwin Hotel. The location is very convenient and the place is great for the price. I am very picky about cleanliness and I feel the Baldwin lives up to my standards. We stayed in a queen bedroom on the fourth floor facing Grant Ave. The room is large enough for our purposes, the bathroom is adequate and clean and there is a ceiling fan with light fixtures. The windows are fairly new but of course it is not going to block out all the normal road noises. This is to be expected. If you want quiet, then ask for a room facing the back but your window will look out at the dark wall 10 feet away. The only con would be the bedding. I find the pillows too hard for my comfort and perhaps they need to have them replaced more often.

Reviews.Title: “Balwin was perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: mimetiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the Chinese New Years Celebration - year of the OX. The Baldwin Hotel was just perfect. We had 4 reservations with other familiy members and we were all happy with our stay. The rooms are exceptionally clean and very comfortable. The staff members were always willing to help with our needs. Hotel stay is just hop and skip away from Chinatown. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scattycat30
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Baldwin for 2 nights which we booked after reading good reviews on here. The room was plenty big enough for our needs and we were overlooking a street which was nice. I'd read reviews about the lift being noisy but apart from my partner getting stuck half in and half out on our arrival (his fault not the lift!) we didn't notice anything although our room was down the landing from it. The bathroom was fairly small but everything in looked new and it was clean as was the room itself. The staff we dealt with were all very helpful and friendly, allowing us to check in early on arrival and we asked them to recommend a chinese restaurant which they did (probably a relative!) and it was fabulous. The location is ideal - minutes walk from Chinatown and Union Square. The price was also great - far cheaper than staying at Fishermans Wharf. The only (slight) problem we had was with parking - upon arrival we were asked if we needed parking and said yes. They gave us a card and told us it was down the block and first left (Sutter Street) so off we went. When we checked out 2 days later, we found we had gone to the wrong car park (there must be 2 on Sutter Street and the one the hotel use is the second one) - this wasn't a problem for us as we hadn't moved the car but beware if you plan to drive anywhere and make sure you find the right car park as the one were in is charged by the hour. By not moving our car it cost us about $2 less than the hotel were charging for 'their' car park but I'm sure parking in theirs would allow you to take your car in and out for the one standard price (about $25 per day). We had to then go back to the hotel, explain what had happened and were given a refund for their car park (maybe they need to explain in more detail where their car park is in future as we were told we weren't the first to make the mistake but it they are clearly losing revenue by doing this)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service/Location”
Reviews.Author: pk580uk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Baldwin for a three night stay. location is excellent just 5 minutes walk from the BART station, minutes to Chinatown, Union Square and Market Street and Fishermans Wharf only 10 minutes ride away on either the cable car or the street tram. The hotel is extremley clean and well maintained. The first room we were given was very dark and overlooked a very dirty yard. There were pigeons roosting on all of the window ledges of all windows which overlooked it and as you can imagine it did not smell too nice, which meant it was impossible to open the window. We askedfor another room and the staff who were all very friendly obliged and we were given a room with a view of the street, a total contrast to the previous room. Dispite the room having a street view we did not notice much noise even with the window open and having read older posts about this hotel the room dwas cool even though the hotel is not equipped with air conditioning. The room had a safe,iron telephone and TV. Wifi was available at a reasonable charge. The bathroom was also very clean and stocked with the usual soap,shower gel etc. Overall I would recommend this hotel and if I ever return to San Fransisco I will stay at The Baldwin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but no A/C”
Reviews.Author: 955Roger
Reviews.Content: The plus points are excellent location. 100 ft from China town, 200 yards from Union Square. Both tram lines less than 5 mins walk. Also cheap and reasonable room size and facilities. Good bathroom. Enough storage space and large free safe in the room. Bad points, NO Air conditioning. It does have a big ceiling fan which worked well but opening the window wasn't a real option as we were on the 9th floor and overlooked the surrounding buildings with their A/C fans making a LOT of noise. We used ear plugs to sleep which made sure we had a good night. Also the building in general is a little cramped. Small lift and corridors. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful when we asked for anything. All were Chinese. The desk staff spoke excellent English but we had trouble conversing with the maids, but we got there.

Reviews.Title: “Location is all!”
Reviews.Author: GammaAO
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights. The room itself was nothing special. It was a bit larger than I expected, since a few reviews described it as "crampy". Perhaps they were refering to other ones. Room view was an absolute nonsense. My window opened to a parking lot, an alley and another building just in front. Since most of the time I stayed inside was to sleep, it didn't bother me. You can get wi-fi in the hotel, but through an external provider which just by itself means an extra charge. The Baldwin Hotel is located right a few meters away from the gate of Chinatown. From there you can easily navigate the streets and check some of the major attractions of SF. Basically, I walked everywhere. You can easily arrange transportation, as I've seen them past ;) The rates and the location are very convincing. If I ever return to San Francisco, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best value SFO small hotel”
Reviews.Author: sg_adventure
Reviews.Content: service at frontdesk & fm housekeeping - very cordial & helpful i hv std rm w 2 windows, v bright & airy & clean too. prefer to hv wall-attached bathtub than the standalone as bath water easily splashed out & wet the floor. it wud b nice 2 bath mat in the tub for safety. my favorite room type is #03. with windows shut, street noise is comfortably quiet for sleep. good to have high floors fm 8-10 for unblock views. location - perfect, very short walking distance to bart, eateries, shoppings, chinatown, union square. fel safe at the hotel vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly reception, but mediocre room for the price”
Reviews.Author: J80-benelux
Reviews.Content: The people at the reception were very friendly and helpful. The room was small but clean. I stayed at the 4th floor and the view wasn't extraordinary (a wall with pigeons), moreover there was quite a lot of (street)noise during the night. Fortunately the location of the hotel made up for all these drawbacks. Overall, a pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location and the price.”
Reviews.Author: Smilentravel
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through hotwire for $53 on a Friday and Saturday night. The room was very clean. The staff at the front desk were always more than helpful. Can't beat the location. In a very good part of Union Square just steps from Chinatown. There is a great place to grab a beer and some fish called the Irish Bank almost right across the street. We used Bart and the Muni system and found it very easily accessible from the hotel. The room was a bit on the small side but more than comfortable for 2. The bed was small and seemed to sink to the center but for the price who can complain. We had a corner room facing Grant. I am a light sleeper so I would hear the different city noises but I found it to be part of the San Francisco experience. I would stay here again for every San Francisco trip if I could get it for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: incongruous
Reviews.Content: The street is noisy, the room is noisy...You could hear the street in your room, as well as the people running, whistling water upstairs. Look out your window and you see a filthy alley. There is no heat or air in the rooms, but they claim heat comes on at 10:00 or 11:00 p.m. As there are no vents, we assume it filters under your door from the hallway. This hotel has zero amenities. I tried to call ahead to get their "knowledgeable" staff to help me set up a surprise for my husband. They couldn't understand what I was saying. Then they flagged my account to ask me again when I showed up, right in front of my husband. They never did understand. We hastily called around to find a nicer hotel and found a 5 star hotel for only $60 more a night. TOTALLY worth the upgrade! We did not stay one night here and left immediately for higher ground, not even upset that we had to leave the Baldwin with one night of payment. If you're used to nice hotels, don't choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: essendon2000
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, nice sized room great bathroom with claw foot bath. Slow lift. Very close to china town which was handy. Starbucks on the corner. Paid $101 per nigh

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RJB21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights as part of as a wider trip around California in March/April. We paid an average of $75 plus tax per night for a standard double room. For San Francisco we felt this was excellent value. The room although not large or particularly stylish was of an adequate size, and clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and included a tub as well as a shower (ie the shower was in the tub). The location was excellent – just a few steps from China Town. It was really easy to get around and we felt safe in the area. After reading other comments on this site, we specifically requested a room away from the lift shaft and didn’t have any problems with noise. Wi-fi is available but there is a daily charge for this so we found it better value to go to a local cafe with free wi-fi instead. No breakfast was provided but coffee was available in the lobby throughout the day. There are lots of cafes etc nearby so finding somewhere for breakfast wasn’t a problem. I’d definitely recommend this as a clean, comfortable and good value base for exploring San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: barbieli
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the positive reviews and good price. The hotel met our expectations: very clean, spotless bathroom, great location, nice staff. I definitively recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: Flamencospain
Reviews.Content: We came to the hotel late in the evening on a saturday night. Our room was out front on the fifth floor right beside the elevator. I had requested a room away from the elevator but was told if I would like to change the room the next day it would be no problem. Coming into the room and feeling how big it was and not having any problem whatswhoever with the elevator, we decided to stay. Yes, wiith an open window you hear the garbage truck pass at 4 am, but with the jetleg you'd be awake anyway. The hotel can easily be reached with public transportation (BART until Montgomery) and a 10Min. walk and it is absolutely safe at any time. The only littel problem we had was that the wakeup call did not come and the guy at the reception was asleep at his table at 5am when we had to leave. Overall we were very happy and pleased with the Baldwin

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: Kennedy87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. For less than $80 a night, it was definitely worth the money. The location is fantastic and the rooms are clean. We felt very safe in this neighborhood, even at night. As said in previous reviews, try to get a room away from the elevator if you're sensitive to noise. We had room #601 and it was right next to the elevator. Luckily we slept ok, but it is not a quiet elevator. If you're just looking for a clean, comfortable place to sleep the Baldwin is perfect. If you're looking for more amenities or plan on spending much time in your room, go somewhere else. Overall, solid hotel. I gave it 4 stars b/c of the rate we paid and I didn't expect too much out of this hotel. If it was over $100 a night it would definitely only be a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Krystal D
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Baldwin for 5 nights in April 2008. I had done a lot of research for our entire USA trip and found that this hotel had the best reviews and was best value for money. We arrived quite late (as our flight from Australia arrived around 9pm), we didnt make it into the city until around 1030ish, but we were met with a warm and thankfully very swift reception. The hotel has a very cosy feel to it, more of a boutique feel, than a hotel (which i preferred). There were rows of SF information in the lobby and also hot coffee and tea available all night. Our room was on the 2nd level (the elevator was not a modern or fast one) which turned out to be great in our case as we could easily walk up and down the stairs to our room!! The room was comfy with a large closet area, safe, tv, nice big comfy bed and a bathroom that was clean and practical (there was hardly any water pressure in the shower), but apart from that it was in a good location, near china town, near public transport, walking distance to the city centre (from memory around 10-15minutes) and secure (they would lock the door after a certain time at night and you need a key to get inside the hotel). they also helped arrange transfers to SFO when we departed. the whole hotel and room were instantly welcoming and i felt right at home as soon as i walked in the door. i would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a great deal in a cosy little boutique hotel. would suggest a lower level floor (to try and avoid using lifts), and would recommend requesting a room not directly facing the main road the hotel is located on. It can get a little noisy during the day, alot of foot traffic (although arriving into USA for the first time, i enjoyed watching people from my window and listening to the new noises).

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in fantastic location for $77/night... can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: zvb
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 4 nights here and were completely satisfied with our choice! The advice from someone on this site to check out priceline.com got us a room for $77/night. The price list on the back of our room door said $199/night. (that would definately not be worth it). Room: - very clean, high ceilings, has all the basics (even a hairdryer...but you have to look for it...it's in the dresser drawer -had wireless internet but it wasn't free. various prices - basically the longer you get it for the cheaper it is per day. we got 3 days for about $25. - view from room 407 was not pretty - a space between buildings and a pipe. But we didn't care, who spends time in their room when there's so much to explore in SF?! -noise level in room 407 was good (not beside elevator) -had heat (apparently the previous reviewer didn't?) Rest of Hotel: - there are a couple couches, vending machines, and coffee/tea/hot water in the lobby... that's about it. A microwave in the hotel would have been nice. - no complaints about staff - kept our luggage safe on our last day while we explored in between check-out and our flight. Location: - where chinatown meets upscale high-class downtown. the hotel is on the upscale side. -easy walking distance to anything you want... even fisherman's wharf is only a 30 minute walk. (nice walk...can see how chinatown morphs to little italy then to mostly apartments then into the fisherman's wharf)

Reviews.Title: “Solid 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: napili
Reviews.Content: I left the Baldwin after a four night stay with mixed feelings. The hotel reminds me of the better B & B hotels one might find in London or Paris. Nice clean room and a spotless bath, but no other amenities. Even the lobby coffee was foul! Also, watch out for the loading/unloading zone in front of the hotel. I parked there for ten minutes, while unloading my bags and checking into the hotel, only to find a $60 ticket when I returned to move the car to their parking garage 2 blocks away. The front desk smiled and said "so sorry!" My good size rear corner room had only a double bed, but was nicely furnished with a view over rooftops. However, no heat! They attempted repairs over the weekend and offered use of a portable electric. Having stayed at numerous S.F. hotels over 40 years, I would probably not come back to the Baldwin. Right now because of the recession you can find a similar deal on a 3 or 4 star hotel nearby. So why bother with the bare bones Baldwin?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: bebe12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Baldwin from Dec 27 - 31, 2008. For its price of $82+/night, it was not a bad choice - room was basic but adequate. The hotel staff is always friendly and happy to help. A couple of things to watch out for : 1. We were not very happy about having to pay for internet connection, even if you use the hotel's PC in the lobby ( at $5 for 20 minutes ). One would need to pay for internet connection in the room as well - not sure how much the internet card is, though. 2. If you do choose to stay in this hotel, please get a room away from the lift because, as mentioned in an earlier review, you can hear the noisy lift shaft from your room every time it's being used. Having said that, the location is great - less than 5 minutes walk to Union Square, lots of cafes in the area and Loehmann's ( designer clothing/accessory bargain store ) just around the corner. You can catch the cable car about 1.5 blocks away - a mere 3 minute stroll from the hotel. There is no breakfast served in the hotel but there is coffee and tea in the lobby every morning. That should not deter anyone as you can get a nice breakfast in any of the cafes nearby. Although this hotel is right in front of the Chinatown gate, one would still have to walk a few blocks to get Chinese food as the stores right after the Gate sells mostly antiques and oriental souvenirs. The restaurant/bar called E&O Trading Company on Sutter Street ( just around the corner from the hotel ) is really worth trying - great Southeast Asian food in a lovely environment. Overall, a nice hotel to live in - would have been great if they do provide free internet as well.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: Nick70Leicester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights early December. Worried that it might be a disaster considering the low cost but what a fantastic little place. On the 'good' side of Union Square with all the designer stores on the doorstep. Honestly I work in Travel and have stayed in some top hotels but the location of this place just can't be beaten. Don't expect luxury. The facilities are non-existent, but if you want nice rooms in a perfect location at a very good price, you can't beat this little gem. Staff very friendly and our stay was extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “My Second Stay at Baldwin - met my expectations again”
Reviews.Author: garrett678
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to SF, but this time with my parents (who's never been there before). As everyone has mentioned, this hotel is strategically located near Union Square (where the shopping is) and Chinatown (where the good/cheap eats are IMO). It is also a couple of blocks away from the Montgomery train station (BART/MUNI trains) and the bus lines on Market street. Furthermore, it is also a block away from the Cablecar line, which is great for tourists like us. The room we stayed at (#305) was clean, although a little small, and was perfect for what we needed. We stayed there for two nights and had no problems whatsoever. They served coffee in the morning, but no breakfast. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had no problems with them. I'd stay there AGAIN when I travel to SF in the future. Its convenience is unbeatable. The price is fair for its location.

Reviews.Title: “A bit noisy - right next to the elevator shaft”
Reviews.Author: gmoney1761
Reviews.Content: We were in room 301 which is situated right next to the elevator and you could hear the elevator going up and down most of the time. We paid $250 for 2 nights during a peak time (Nike Women's Marathon) so most likely that was a good deal for a place so close to Union Square and during that time, however I don't think your room should have so much noise that it's challenging to get any sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Ginger1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, just a block off Union Square, so close to shops and restaurants, you couldn't ask for more. The room inself was fairly standard, but top marks for cleanliness. The double bed was quite small, but the good thing was that you could open a window and have some fresh air, not like so many hotels in USA that just have air conditioning. The tea and coffee making facilities were in reception, rather than in the room, no big deal as the lift was quick so only took 2 mins to go down and grab a hot drink. The staff were very helpful, didn't see any of the housekeeping staff, but the receptionists couldn't do enough for us. I would most certainly stay here again and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with friendly atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Rugbyskippy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early October and even though we had done our homework on location, were pleasantly pleased with the hotels location. In the heart of the city, just a few steps away from Chinatown and easy access to the two cable car lines or street cars, to give you quick tranportation to the main attraction areas. Ok there is street noise but then again you are in the centre of a city and the lift can be heard but not enough to disturb you. Our room was on the ninth floor and the view from the window overlooking the roof tops was lovely, the bathroom was very modern, and it was handy to have a safe deposit box in you room at no extra charge. We found the hotel recepitionists all to be very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: quickjaunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights from Oct 24-26th. For some reason, a lot of the hotels were sold out over the weekend and we ended up here. It is a 5 minute walk from the Bart Station at Montgomery St. Stayed in room 302 for 142/night. There is no air conditioning in the room, but the ceiling fan was sufficient. You can you open the windows for an additional breeze, but from previous posters, there is a noise factor. Bathroom was small and clean. There is a desk and chair, flat screen tv, blow dryer is in a drawer under the tv, queen size bed. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We Picked a Winner!”
Reviews.Author: Tercher
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to San Francisco and were overwhelmed by all the choices on Trip Advisor. This little hotel seemed to stand out as being in an excellent location and at an affordable price. We had a super worry free week. Each day we would step out onto the street to a new adventure. We also took advantage of the 3 day transit pass and it worked out great. From the hotel you can walk to alot of destinations if you are so inclined. The front desk were polite and efficient and helped arrange our shuttle for the trip back to the airport. Cleaning staff are awesome !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value & central location”
Reviews.Author: Nika44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a nice central location close to Chinatown and Union Square. The recption staff was friendly and the room was nice and clean (although we were bemused to find everything from the TV remote control to the hairdryer nailed/screwed/velcroed/glued to the furniture) and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loepie
Reviews.Content: A very decent hotel at a great location. China town and Union square are at a very short walking distance. The hotel itself is clean and bathrooms have been recently renovated. Keep in mind that the hotel is at quite a noisy location. If you are sensitive to noise I would not recommend th Baldwin. Earplugs will prove to be useful. All in all a great hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Altoir
Reviews.Content: I great hotel, with a smiling staff. Everything was great, older hotel but we did not hear the elevator or the trafic at all. Great service all the way through, and the staff was more then willing to help out. Had game tickets sent to the hotel before i arrived and the first thing they gave me was my football game tickets, another great service. One thing i am missing is a small fridge though, as the ice bucket just dosnt cut it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and a great deal”
Reviews.Author: MandMK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a complete gem.The location is absolutely fantastic - you are within walking distance of 2 BART stations, the cable car line, Union Square and Chinatown. The front desk staff were very helpful. The rooms were very tired looking but in a way that looked that it had been cleaned a lot over the years. Looking like it has been cleaned a lot is not a bad thing for a room! The shower was not very good and the elevator was slow. But apart from that I think this is a great hotel for people planning to do lots of shopping or partying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Martha_FL
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, few steps to Chinatown, a few blocks to Union Square, BART and cable cars. Clean room and bathroom, bearable noise (came to room so tired, didn't even pay attention to that))), friendly staff, cheap rate. Would stay there again without doubt, were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “nice area”
Reviews.Author: happimags
Reviews.Content: This is the conclusion of our tour across america. The hotel was comfortable and just right for our needs. The location was nice just right really for a short walk down to union square or simply jump on the various transport available. What a shame there are so many beggars and drunks around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little Hotel in the heart of it all!”
Reviews.Author: nurselins1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Baldwin at the end of September and had a wonderful time! The hotel is perfectly located, right in the center of it all! Very charming place, room was perfect and comfortable, with a private bath!! Hotel staff very helpful and knowledgable about the city, ect! I will stay here again in the future! Absolutely loved the Baldwin!

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: bea832
Reviews.Content: PROS: The Baldwin Hotel has a location that can't be beat. My husband and I chose the hotel because It is easily accessible near the Montgomery BART station and the venue of the wedding we were attending. Also, it is just a block away from Chinatown (you can literally see the Chinatown gate from the hotel doorway), North Beach, and is amidst all the great downtown SF shopping. The staff were helpful and housekeeping service was good. Room decor was classy and clean. CONS: There is no free internet service which seems crazy to me in this day and age, especially in a city like San Francisco. Also, the only elevator is this loud old machine and our room happened to be right next to it. Try to request a room that is not adjacent to the elevator, otherwise you will be tossing and turning on Saturday nite when people return to the hotel at all hours of the night. Another downside is the only ice machine is in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: ShugaC
Reviews.Content: My hubby & I took a 5 day trip to SF & stayed at the Baldwin. We couldn't have been more pleased! Sure the room was a little dated, but it only adds to its charm. We booked a "double" room, thinking that meant a queen size bed, but I think it was a full size. But we made do with it! We could've upgraded, but how much were we really going to sleep while in such a great city! The elevator was a little slow, but we were on the top floor & had an amazing view! We slept with our windows open for the fresh air & because we were so high up, traffic noise was not a problem. We had friends in the city & when they came to pick us up from the hotel they couldn't believe the location! They are going to have other friends & family stay there while visiting them. Again, I can't state any clearer how great this location was! Walking distance to everything. We took the metro quite a bit & it was easy to use! Great little bagel shop with fresh juice around the corner for breakfast! We ate at Farallon (amazing!) and Bix Supperclub (quite an experience! we even saw a couple of actors there!) If you have any other questions, just shoot me a message!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here Oct 2007. Good hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Basics100
Reviews.Content: After what felt like months of trawling the pages of trip advisor, we finally decided on the Baldwin Hotel as it fitted in with our requirements of budget and location and had good reviews by fellow trip advisor members. The Baldwin is more than central, right at the gates of China Town and just a few blocks from Union Square. We originally booked a double room and then decided to upgrade to a queen. However, when we were shown the room the bed looked awfully small, like a 3/4 size, but when we checked with reception we were assured that it was in fact a queen size room. (I think this may be a language barrier between Americans and Brits so do check before booking, I think perhaps the double could have been a twin!!) Anyway, the room was in no way a problem. The bed was small, but cosy (boyfriend is 6ft 4); the room and bathroom were cleaned every day (left a 2 dollar tip every day). The sheets were clean and towels were fluffy and plentiful. The bathroom was lovely with a traditional cast iron bath with plenty of hot water and an EXCELLENT shower (I have a thing about hotel showers!!) all in all we were very happy and comfortable. On the down side (there isn't much), the decor is a little dated, but you're not in San Francisco to see hotel decor. There are NO tea/coffee making facilities in the room, so bring a travel kettle and supplies. The hotel advertises tea/coffee facilities in the lobby, however every time my boyfriend went for a coffee, there wasn't any, or worse it was always cold. Did not see any tea for the entire stay. The only other negative thing was the lack of air conditioning. Now coming from good old UK, we don't know the modern phenomenon of air conditioning, but I imagine that this could be a problem for some people. We were at the Baldwin in the last week of October 2007 and there was a bit of a heat wave. Temperatures were between 79 to 84F (26-28C) degrees everyday. We had the window open by day, but it gets very noisy outside due to the hotel's central location. It wasn't a problem for us, but I wouldn't advise staying here at the height of summer unless the hotel gets some air con. The staff greeted us very warmly and remained this way for the rest of the week, directing us to the post office, advising on trips, ordering cabs etc Our stay was room only so we had to forage for food everyday, but you will never go hungry or bored of food in San Francisco. We had sushi, Chinese, Italian, fish and so on and so on. Here are some of my favourite places to eat. 1. Cheesecake Factory top floor of Macy's. Very popular and touristy but well worth it. 2. North Beach Restaurant in Little Italy. So delicious, the best pasta outside of Rome. Quite expensive, but worth a treat. Brilliant traditional fine dining 3. Capps Corner. Americanised version of Italian cuisine. Generous portions, cheap and very very cheerful. 4. Mayflower Market. This is a little deli/mini-market on Bush street between Stockton Street and Grant Avenue (around the corner from the hotel) You can get all sorts here, fruit, bagels, sandwiches, crisps etc All to help you have that cheap breakfast/lunch. San Francisco is the most amazing city and there is so much to see and do. Highlights of the week were the visit to Alcatraz (pre-book online before you go) Golden Gate Bridge, Japanese Tea Gardens, San Francisco Zoo, Haight-Ashbury District, Pier 39, and Muir Woods. Although you'll find the most amazing and interesting things around every corner. If you haven't worked it out by now, I simply LOVE San Francisco and sincerely hope that I will go back one day. I hope that you will love it just as much as me!! Please Enjoy:-)

Reviews.Title: “No worries here”
Reviews.Author: MrWright1974
Reviews.Content: Lovely little clean hotel. On the Union square side of SF but close to the tram lines which take you to Fishermans Wharf & you won't tire of getting on the trams, they're like an atraction in themselves & really enjoyable to ride. Starbucks is a couple of doors up the road a good way to start the day before you head off. I will be going back to San Fran because it is such an amazing city & will definitely try & book the Baldwin again. Make sure you hire a GoCar for the day & be sure to book the evening Alcatraz tour well in advance on the net. Both superb experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: keeptahoeblue
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly adequate old-school hotel in an ideal location two blocks off Union Square - but on the good side, outside the Chinatown gate, rather than the Tenderloin side- for an un-heard of price. They let us book for only one night on a weekend and we paid $127 for a queen. Yes, the room is small and dated. But it was clean and the window opened for fresh air, and the bed was comfortable with down-like pillows that didn't tweak my neck. The room had a fabulous claw-foot bathtub that I could actually soak in all the way to my neck, and HOT water. My husband was running the marathon and had to get up at 3:30 am and he got a very good night's sleep. I can see it would be noisy if there were noisy people on our floor, but we didn't have that problem, and as to street noise, well, it's a city. A big city and this hotel is downtown and it has old-style windows. They contract with the 450 Sutter garage, which was $25 for 24 hours, with in and out privileges. The front desk was very friendly and she let us check out at noon instead of eleven. The downsides: no coffeemaker, and the coffee service in the lobby was pretty grim, with powdered creamer. There is a nice cafe across the street, but since I live locally I would just bring my own little coffeemaker next time. The hairdryer did not work and the elevator is slooooooow. But for the price, I would totally stay here again, the location is absolutely ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: nettyuk
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't have been better - right near the gates to chinatown, and round the block from union square, and all the transport routes. Can't complain at all!

Reviews.Title: “Basically OK”
Reviews.Author: MNDC
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin is OK. The staff are friendly, the location is good (right near Chinatown) and the windows open, so you can get fresh air. I also liked the fact that it was not affiliated with a chain. My only complaint is that it's frumpy without being interesting. All of the furnishings look like they were chosen by someone who had forgotten his glasses and randomly picked things out at a Home Depot closeout sale.

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kapulanikai
Reviews.Content: Quiet, off-season inexpensive and a great staff make this the "location" to stay in. You just can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal!”
Reviews.Author: Karara
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 night stay here. The staff are helpful, the rooms spotless and the location great. I am so glad we didn't go for some fancy named hotel with no substance. The ceiling fan was totally adequate (coming from Scotland I was surprised how chilly San Francisco could be!!), and although not the biggest the room definitely big enough. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for good value close to Union Sq

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: CABurke
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin Hotel is an excellent choice of lodging in San Francisco. We could see the gate to ChinaTown from our window. You can walk anywhere from this location. It is a few minutes walk to the BART, cable cars, buses and many wonderful restaurants. We couldn't have picked a more perfect location at a reasonable price!!! Our room was spacious, very comfortable and clean. Though our room faced the street the noise of traffic, garbage trucks, etc.... was not enough to bother us or keep us awake. The people at the front desk were always very helpful in answering any questions. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Coolba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed in the Baldwin Hotel for five nights and we enjoyed a very pleasant stay. We booked through an online service, pre-paid and took BART from San Francisco Airport, with a subway stop three blocks from the Baldwin. Check-in was quick and easy. Our room was on the 10th floor, with a queen-size bed and private bath. The room was small but very clean and the maid service every day was thorough. There were only two pillows on the bed but when we asked for two more they happily complied. I have read some complaints about the front desk but that was not our experience at all; they were always very friendly and helpful. The first night we stayed there it was hot but a ceiling fan kept it pretty comfortable. After that the temp. dropped and it was very comfortable. The elevator is slow but not so much as to be a problem. The location is excellent, right down the block from Chinatown; just beyond Chinatown is North Beach (a little Italy) and a bit farther Coit Tower (with another slow elevator that is worth the $5 charge to the top, where there are spectacular views). Union Square is also near, as is the cable car terminus down to Fisherman's Wharf. Trips to Alacatraz leave from Pier 33 but make a reservation - those trips fill up fast in the summer. The cable car trip is fun but there are long waits at the turn-arounds. We also took BART to the F line trolley to Fisherman's Wharf, which also worked well. There's also a Starbucks just up the block from the Baldwin. Checkout is at 11 a.m. and our plane did not leave until 5 p.m. However, they let us leave our bags at the front desk and we wandered around Chinatown for a few more hours. One depressing note: there are a lot of homeless in the general area, though we did not see any congregating at the Baldwin. Some are pretty aggressive demanding money though overall it is more than anything else a very sad testiment to our society's inability to make these folks' lives better than sleeping on the streets and begging.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: NVRoaddog
Reviews.Content: Cozy in every sense of the word. Our room was small but comfortable. Very clean, new furniture, good bed. Nice bathroom with claw-foot tub. Made for some "interesting" showers and a really nice bath. As reported, no a/c, but the ceiling fan helped. Our window opened to the alley so there was some street noise. Forwarned, we brought a small sound machine. If the fan is enough, the double-paned windows shut out the outside noise excellently. No noise from the room next door. The staff is friendly, responsive, and knowledgable about the area. The Baldwin is a great starting point to just about anywhere in town. Cable cars, busses, and BART all nearby. Reasonable by San Francisco standards, the Baldwin is a real find! P.S. The (single) elevator is no slower than a lot of hotels I've been in, and faster than some.

Reviews.Title: “Cant complain at all”
Reviews.Author: jocka
Reviews.Content: Only good things to say about this hotel. Excellent value, close to many sights, and public transport. Good size room, nice new clean bathroom. Cant think of any way to fault the Baldwin. I will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staffs service”
Reviews.Author: ChinWen
Reviews.Content: Baldwin Hotel has the best location...easy access to great restaurants, bars and stores....a great place to stay...the staffs were very helpful, the room is clean....a great place to stay....would definitely stay there again if i ever visit SF again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Great location”
Reviews.Author: SanneNL
Reviews.Content: A Great hotel on a Great location, 10 steps away from the gate to China Town and 2 blocks from Union Square. Great value for this location. Be aware of two things: 1.
